112640.name: Supreme Commissar
112640.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Supreme Commissar is the founder and leader of the Red Directorate, the primary Soviet agency for the oversight of meta-human affairs. Gifted with a tenacity and deviousness that rival Rasputin's, he outmaneuvers his rivals in both the West and East like a seasoned chessmaster while opposing any threats to the USSR, be they from scheming mutant supervillains, alien invaders or ancient supernatural evil.

112641.name: Majestic-12
112641.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Agent Majestic-12 is a cold-blooded CIA agent whose ongoing assignment is kidnapping meta-humans from Soviet Bloc countries in order to prevent their recruitment into the Warsaw Pact's super-soldier program. His fearsome reputation has grown to urban legend amongst the metahumans of the Eastern Bloc, but the truth is far stranger than they even dare to imagine...

112642.name: Sovi-Ape
112642.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Once a respected simian Soviet super-soldier, Sovi-Ape has gone rogue and founded a terrorist group, the Post-Human Liberation Front. Now the super-intelligent man-ape hybrid is determined to wreak havoc on a world that never gave his genius the respect it deserved.

112643.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 5 No 3 - Fall 2041)
112643.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," 10 O'clock News, Convention Calendar, Movie Releases, Mayor's Corner, Cheryl and Doc, Combat Rock, The Showroom, Milestones, NOVA Awards, Cube Logs, Duelling in Europe, & Closing Fire.

112644.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 5 No 4 - Winter 2041)
112644.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," 10 O'clock News, Convention Calendar, Movie Releases, Murphy's Corner, Duel Slang, In the Arena, Combat Rock, The Showroom, Milestones, Local Hero, Cube Logs, & Closing Fire.

112645.description:
For untold centuries a war has been waged in the shadows cast by the moon. Two great powers of the underworld clash in repetitive fury, fighting for ultimate supremacy. The hedonistic Vampires believe it to be their birthright to own the night. The untamed Werewolves believe that none other than themselves should master the Earth. Whose claim is true? When twilight descends, which species will set the ancient records in stone and prove their powers of domination? Time to settle old scores. It’s time to Bare Your Fangs!

Bare Your Fangs is a two-player dice fighting game devoted to resolving once and for all which species will reign supreme: Vampire or Werewolf. Players choose their faction dice and roll to attack! The fully customized die icons determine successful hits, blocks, and of course, one’s ability to hunt for humans and thereby heal wounds incurred in these savage battles. But there is always risk. Some humans won’t go down without a fight! And one particular human seeks only the total annihilation of all creatures of the night. The Werewolf’s physical power is unmatched but the Vampire’s ability to heal is legendary. Only one will rule when dawn breaks, but will the victor crush his opponent into oblivion and take his rightful place as Leader Eternal, or will the fang fray destroy them both!
112645.name: Bare Your Fangs

112647.name: PC-8801
112647.description:
The NEC PC-8801 was an early Zilog Z80-based computer exclusively released in Japan, where it became very popular, by NEC Corporation in 1981. It was informally called the "PC-88".

The PC-8801BE was launched as a business computer in the UK with 8" floppy drives around 1982 but it was not as successful as the PC-8001 it was intended to replace. Variations of the PC-8801 were also sold in the United States.

For its time, the PC-8801SR (V2-mode) had a high display resolution, but could only display 8 out of 512 colors simultaneously. The 640 × 400 mode was monochrome only. Its sound-producing capabilities were also more advanced than other machines of the time.

Companies that produced exclusive software for the NEC PC-8801 included Enix, Square, Sega, Falcom, Bandai Soft, Hal Laboratory, ASCII, Pony, T&E Soft, Wolf Team, Dempa, Champion Soft, Starcraft, Micro Cabin, PSK, and Bothtec. Certain games produced for the PC-8801 had a shared release with the MSX, such as those produced by Game Arts, ELF, and Konami. Many popular series first appeared on the NEC PC-8801, including Snatcher, Thexder, Dragon Slayer, RPG Maker, and Ys.

Nintendo licensed Hudson Soft to port some of Nintendo's Family Computer games for the console, including Excitebike, Balloon Fight, Tennis, Donkey Kong 3, Golf, and Ice Climber, as well as new editions of Mario Bros. called Mario Bros. Special and Punch Ball Mario Bros. and a unique Super Mario Bros. game for the computer, Super Mario Bros. Special.

The computer also had its own BASIC dialect: N88-BASIC.

Source: Wikipedia, "NEC PC-8801", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112648.name: Shadow President
112648.description:
User Summary

A political-military simulation in which the player assumes the Presidency of the United States and through his actions, he seeks to be re-elected.

Diplomacy, military, strategy and ethics combine to give the player a Realpolitik as of 1990.

112650.name: The Black Bass
112650.description:
The Black Bass (ザ・ブラックバス) is a 1986 fishing video game developed and published by Gamu (later known as HOT・B). It was originally released for the MSX computer in 1986, and was later ported to the Family Computer (NES) on March 18, 1987 in Japan.

The objective is for the player to catch as many black bass as possible from sunrise to sunset. The player may select a beginner's game or ranking game. A ranking game requires a password. From here, a player may select a location on the lake to start at and begin fishing. Simply tossing a lure out with the desired power will start the process. A fish can be lured in by moving the lure around and if it bites, then the player can try reeling it in. Care must be taken, however when reeling, as too much constant reeling leads to the line breaking, and the loss of both the fish and the lure.

Between casting rounds, the player can make certain selections. Among the selections available is the option to change the type and or color of lure being used.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Black Bass (MSX)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112651.name: Super Bowling (SNES)
112651.description:
Four computer opponents are available, two female and two male. There are three modes: Golf, Normal, and Practice where the player constructs his own scenarios and practices knocking down the bowling pins with either one or two balls.

The SNES version takes place in a bowling alley during the late 1950s, even though the characters use late 1980s/early 1990s adolescent slang words.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Bowling", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112652.name: Super Chase H.Q. (SNES)
112652.description:
In 1993, Taito released Super Chase H.Q. for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System. It is played in first person perspective and stems from Super Chase: Criminal Termination rather than the original Chase H.Q.. Gameplay is modeled on the original with some aspects of S.C.I. incorporated. There is also a Super Chase H.Q. for the Game Boy, which was released exclusively in North America, in 1994. The game structure is similar to the Game Boy's Taito Chase H.Q. (1991).

Source: Wikipedia, "Chase H.Q.", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112654.name: Super Double Dragon
112654.description:
Super Double Dragon, known in Japan as Return of Double Dragon (リターン・オブ・双截龍), is a side-scrolling beat-'em-up released for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System in 1992. It was published by Technos Japan Corp. in Japan and by Tradewest in North America and the PAL region. Super Double Dragon is the fourth console game in the Double Dragon series developed by Technos, following previous titles for the NES, although unlike the NES games, Super Double Dragon is an original title and not based on any preceding arcade version.

As with previous installments of the series, the player takes control of martial artists Billy and Jimmy in their fight against the Shadow Warriors gang. The objective is to proceed through each stage and defeat all enemies, including a boss. The game consists of seven stages, which includes a casino, an airport, a martial arts gym, a fight atop a moving truck, a city slum, a forest, and the hideout of the boss.

In addition to the punch, kick, and jump buttons, the player now has a guard button for blocking attacks. If the player times the guard button right, their character can not only defend against an enemy's punch, they can also put certain enemies in an arm grab, leaving the enemy vulnerable to successive attacks. There's also a "Dragon Power" gauge under the life gauge, which the player can fill by holding down L or R buttons. While the gauge is filling up, the player can perform special attacks which vary depending on how much power the player has accumulated, which includes a flying hurricane kick. If the power gauge is completely filled, then the player's regular attacks will gain extra strength for a limited period. In contrast to previous Double Dragon games, Jimmy Lee (the Player 2 character) has different punching attacks than Billy Lee (Player 1). In the Japanese version, his Roundhouse Kick is also different.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Double Dragon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112656.name: Système D
112656.description:
French Introduction
SYSTÈME D est un jeu de rôles simple. Une espèce de couteau suisse qui permet d’adapter (presque) n’importe quel univers et de vous lancer rapidement avec un mini-mum de préparation.
Le but n’est pas de proposer des règles réalistes, juste un système pour encadrer le principal : une aventure et les personnages qui la vivront !
Par son côté intuitif, ces règles s’adressent davantage à des me-neurs de jeu expérimentés qui sauront faire preuve d’improvisa-tion... et d’un grand sens de l’a-daptation.

Google Translation
SYSTEM D is a simple role-playing system, a kind of Swiss army knife that you can customize for (almost) any universe and get started quickly with a minimum of preparation.
The goal is not to propose realistic rules, just to provide a system to supervise the primary focus of RPGing: an adventure and the characters who will live in them!
Through its intuitive, these rules are intended more for more experienced gamer and will encourage improvisation... and a great need for adaptation.

112657.name: Synapse Rules
112657.description:
French Introduction
SYNAPSE est un système de règles pour jeu de rôle pouvant s'adapter à un nombre quasiment infini d'univers. SYNAPSE vous offre ainsi la possibilité de déchaîner votre imagination, de traverser les âges, de vivre plusieurs vies, de découvrir différents mondes passés et à venir...

Google Translation
SYNAPSE is a system of rules for role-playing game that can accommodate an almost infinite number of universes. SYNAPSE offers you the opportunity to unleash your imagination, through the ages, to live many lives, to discover different worlds past and future ...

112660.name: Darkness Visible
112660.description:
Subtitle: Espionage Campaigns for Stars Without Number

Publisher Blurb:
Discover Sights of Woe

Rain-slick streets beneath an alien sky. Untraceable mail on a private terminal. A man in a shabby coat who is always watching. Poison in a glistening needle. From the distant ages of humanity’s dawn to the far end of the Silence, espionage changes only its tools. A useful lie is eternal.

With this book, GMs and players are equipped with everything they need to run campaigns of interstellar intrigue and covert action. New backgrounds, training packages and equipment options will kit out your starfaring spies, and the history and context of interstellar espionage will help you plan your adventures in a cosmos in dire need.

GMs are given special help in assembling an espionage campaign, with tools for the cooperative creation of enigmatic intelligence agencies and long-hidden Perimeter outposts. You’ll also find concrete, step-by-step techniques for building complex spy adventures and sinister plots, complete with detailed support material to keep your focus on the fun.

Look inside to find...


The history of interstellar spying in the Stars Without Number universe.
Details of the hideous maltech cults that threaten the very future of humanity.
A system for cooperatively creating intelligence agencies for your campaign and handling exploits against their nefarious rivals.
36 new tags for flavoring your cults, all of which can be used as world tags as well.
Over 200 new adventure seeds, each one keyed to a different aspect of an espionage agency.
NPC, scheme, and method tables for fleshing out conspiracies and dark plots.

112661.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 6 No 1 - Spring 2042)
112661.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," 10 O'clock News, Convention Calendar, Movie Releases, Return Fire, Duelling Ideas, Duel Slang, On the Road, Combat Rock, The Showroom, Cheryl and Doc: Part 2, Cube Logs, The Weasel Speaks Out, & Closing Fire.

112662.name: Medabots AX
112662.description:
Box Description:

More Medabots. More power.

Every four years the greatest Medafighters around the world come together for the World Robattle Tournament. Join Ikki and Metabee as they take on the toughest Medafighters and their Medabots to prove who is the best of the best! Team work and strategy are key. Completely customize your Medabots for action-Win and you'll earn rare and valuable Medaparts. Lose and your Medabot might be scrapped!

All the action is in your hands... "Medabots Robattle!"

-Features characters and Medabots seen on the Medabots TV animated series!

-Create and control your own Medabot!

-Robattle or trade Medaparts with other players!

-Over three million combinations of Medaparts!

-Metabee Version includes exclusive Medaparts and Medals not found in Medabots AX: Rokusho Version!

112663.name: Medabots: Metabee & Rukuhso
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
North American Game Boy Advance Rokusho edition
112663.description:
User Summary

Based on the anime, this is an RPG where you put your Medabot against your foes. You can customize your Medabot with Medaparts. Medaparts are weapons that can be gained when a foe has been defeated.

112664.description:
The Hatter’s Table is board game about discovering the hidden and wonderfully strange rules that govern an apparently irrational situation. Set around the Mad Hatter’s table, players must dash around the Wonderland tea party while trying to figure out what secret rules govern the other players' movement. The Mad Hatter character serves as both an audio guide and aid to chaos.

How do you play?

Each player has a secret rule. When play begins, the Mad Hatter shouts out instructions about where to move around the table: "Go sit at a tea cup," "Take a seat next to the March Hare," "Move one place counter-clockwise." Players move their tokens accordingly, unless they find themselves in a situation where they must follow their secret rule instead.

Your goal is to guess what secret rules the other players are following. If you can do so successfully, you are rewarded with buttons, and the first player to get fifteen buttons wins the game!

At first, the game might seem like madness, but once you get the hang of it you'll learn to use some strategy. Watch the other players carefully and take note whenever they disobey the Hatter's direction - that's when you know they must be following their rule. Each place around the table has two different states, and every state has two positions around the table. When the Hatter tells you to sit next to the March Hare, a clever player will pick the spot next to the Hare that will best hide their secret rule.
112664.name: The Hatter's Table

112665.name: Puff Ball
112665.description:
Spears action game.

THe board has 8 sections, with a goal at the appropriate at every alternate side. If two play, opposite sections are played. If four play, then all goal-sections are used.

Each player has a 'puffer', a miniature bellows that, when pressed, ejects a stream of air. The object is to 'blow' the ball around the board, trying to get it into an opponent's goal.

The first to score 6 goals is the winner.

112667.name: Galactic Civilizations: Deluxe Edition
112667.description:
Rear of Case

Galactic Civilization Gold Edition includes the original award-winning game and the new Altarian Prophecy Expansion Set.

Features of the Altarian Prophecy Expansion Set
2 New Civilizations to play as well as all your old favourites
New Huge Campaigns
Heaps of new game content that adds more depth to your gaming experience
Virtual endless re playability

112668.name: Metalface
112668.description:
Introduction
The future came and went with devastating results. Those who survived have rebuilt global communities out of remaining governments and organizations. Self-sustaining profiles now control vast areas and enforce strict rule over them. Even life itself is granted for a price.

Metalface is set in a futuristic world of corporate warfare, robotic combat and the ever evolving human spirit. Where anything is possible with technology, nothing is what it seems, and the greatest threats come from the desires within us all.

112669.name: Öko-Detektiv
112669.description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible

- roll & move game with action cards; moving by turn -
Each player tries to roll & move, picking up cards, helping enviroment and moving his/her stone along the scoring board/row
for more involved detectives (age 10..) a 'tracing set' can be added

Content:
1 board
5 wooden meeples (= 'Öko-detectives')
5 wooden stones (scoring)
1 special 6-sided wooden die
30 wooden chips
26 event cards
12 cards for environmental sins
8 action slides
5 tracing-set-cards
1 rules

112670.name: Space Man 2 Man
112670.description:
Miniature rules for tactical scale.
Science fiction infantry battles.

Space Man-2-Man was designed to reproduce large scale, tactical level Science Fiction miniature battles. The scale of the game is 1" equal 6 feet and each 'turn' for a combat group taking from 30 seconds to a few minutes. The game is designed with 25mm figures, but should be easy to covert the charts, movement rates and playing surface size to suit another scale if necessary.

112671.name: En busca de Eldorado
112671.description:
"In Search of Eldorado" (In search of Eldorado) is a strategy game involving 2 teams (expeditionaries and indigenous) that can be composed of 1, 2 or 3 players each

The expeditionaries mission is a sea voyage aboard their galleons, from its port to the land of the Indians.

There are 3 pyramids spread over the territory of these.

Below one of the 3 pyramids is Eldorado. It'll be known by the brand that bears on the base. The only ones who know which of the pyramids is marked are the Indians.

The aim of the expedition will be to find and seize the pyramid that contains Eldorado and take it to the port where the expedition departed.

The Indians will be guarding the 3 pyramids, thus hindering the expeditionaries discovering which of them is Eldorado.

His other mission will be hunt down and eliminating the expeditionaries as soon as they land.

If any of the expeditionaries manages to find and grab the pyramid of Eldorado, the Indians will use all means at its disposal by land and sea to recover and return the pyramid of Eldorado to their place of origin.

The members of each team will decide among them wich piece they move each turn.

112672.name: Max Payne 3
videogamehonor: 2012 Spike Best Original Score of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
112672.description:
Max Payne 3 is the third installment in Rockstar Games Max Payne series and is set eight years after the events of the last installment.

No longer a cop, Max is close to washed-up, drunk and addicted to painkillers. Without a job on the force, Max has left the greater New York area, and finds himself in Sao Paulo, Brazil, working as private security.

The story of Max's descent from vengeful, leather-jacket wearing detective roaming the alleys of New York to the broken, shaven-headed man out for justice on unfamiliar streets far from home is at the center of Max Payne 3.

In addition to Max's classic shoot-dodge moves, there is now a combination of Natural Motion's Euphoria character behavior system and Bullet Time to enhance his moves.

Partners and sidekicks will play a large role in this game to help Max in his quest for vengeance.

Source: The Game Website.

112673.name: Heavy Fire: Afghanistan
112673.description:
Knock out the enemy with your Heavy Fire!
Heavy Fire: Afghanistan is a super fast playing, high intensity experience set in modern-day Afghanistan. Whether fighting up close and personal with guns and grenades, raining down fire from a helicopter or laying waste with a main battle tank, Heavy Fire: Afghanistan is all about constant, edge-of-the-seat action and beautiful graphics combined with straightforward, intuitive controls to give hardcore gamers and novices an immediately fun, pickup-and-play experience.
Features:

• 24 high-action missions
• More than 60 awards, ranks, and equipment upgrades
• Leaderboard to see how you stack up
• 1-4 players, cooperative play

Source: The Game Website.

112674.name: Heavy Fire: Black Arms
112674.description:
Set on a dangerous campaign in South America in a continuation of the popular WiiWare™ game Heavy Fire: Special Ops. As a special forces recruit you will take part in the operation to stop illegal arms trade. Heavy Fire brings players an arcade classic light-gun fun enhanced with stunning graphics and new exciting features.

Destroy the biggest weapon cartel, Fuerza de Voluntad, influential all over the continent. You can team up with your friend and experience an immersive co-op mode. Enjoy dynamic minute-to-minute game-play in various weather conditions and settings in the heart of a jungle. Smash objects and interact with them, perform quick events and face your enemies with new more powerful weapons. With plenty of weapon types and various vehicles like trucks, helicopters and boats at disposal, put an end to the expansion of the paramilitary organization!

Take full advantage of the Wii Remote™ and Nintendo’s Wii Zapper™ peripheral as the stakes is higher than ever! Play to finish the game or just to improve your best score.

Features:

• Totally new explosive and dynamic minute to minute game-play in various settings and weather conditions
•Missions from the ground, boats and helicopters with special gestures to perform (quick events)
•Advance in ranks and gain more and more powerful weapons
•New interactive and destructible objects (e.g. flying airplanes) with various destruction levels and splash damage effect
•New Save System (checkpoints during the missions)
•Wii Zapper™ and Wii Remote™ support
•Immersive co-op experience for 2 players

Source: The Game Website.

112675.name: Severed Union 1861-1865
112675.description:
Severed Union 1861-1865 is a historical miniature war-game, which is the first release from Gordon & Hague War-games. The game uses 10mm pre-painted war-game miniatures to allow players to relive the greatest battles of the American Civil War. This game is a turn based in which each player will take turns moving, firing and charging. There are multiple ways to win according to what style of game you are playing. There are "take and hold" battles where you must capture key objectives around the battlefield in a specified amount of turns or simply play a "total destruction" game where you must destroy the enemy and run them from the tabletop!

The miniatures are 10mm in scale and pre-painted and are ready for battle right out of the box. The Severed Union Rulebook is free to download from our the Gordon & Hague website. There is an advanced 40 page rulebook for veteran war-gamers and there is also a 4 page quick-start rulebook for newcomers and children.

The game mechanics are based mainly around dice rolling and measuring. Maneuvering your units is also very important as you receive bonuses for being on high-ground and in or behind protective cover such as fences, buildings and forests.

112676.name: LEGO Harry Potter: Years 5-7
112676.description:
Lego Harry Potter: Years 5-7 is based on the Lego Harry Potter line and is based on the final four films in the Harry Potter series: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 1, and Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 2.

Source: Wikipedia, "[LEGO Harry Potter: Years 5-7," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112677.name: The Silver Lining: Episode 3: My Only Love Sprung From My Only Hate
112677.description:
The third episode of the long awaited The Silver Lining is here!

Graham's quest continues as his world falls further apart and grows more mysterious: strange visions of old foes, the enigmatic Ranger's riddles, unexplained oddities in the Isles,
and now Queen Valanice seems to have reached her breaking point.

Game Features:
• Delve deeper into the Isle of Mists and discover the ancient wisdom of the Druids.
• Experience intricate puzzles and an exhilirating action sequence.
• Meet new and old friends of a wonderfully and fully voiced cast.
• Explore new and expanded locations in the familiar kingdom of the Green Isles.
• Continue your journey as King Graham of Daventry in search of the ingredients to save his children.

Source: The Game Website.

112678.name: The Silver Lining: Episode 4: Tis in My Memory Locked and You Yourself Shall Keep the Key of It
112678.description:
The penultimate episode of The Silver Lining!

When the source of an immense evil surfaces from the depths of an ancient artifact, Graham finds himself in a race against time to collect the final ingredients for the spell to save his children. Back in the castle, Valanice struggles with a destiny that is as dark as her own origins...

Game Features:

• Fully explore the Land of the Green Isles, including the Isle of the Beast and the Isle of the Sacred Mountain
• Complete the spell to journey into the Dreamworld
• Unlock the answers to new puzzles and action sequences
• Delve deeper into the secrets of Graham's past
• The first Episode with a second playable character!

Source: The Game Website.

112679.name: Wizorb
112679.description:
The once peaceful Kingdom of Gorudo is threatened by an evil presence. The only hope for salvation is Cyrus, a wizard versed not only in both black and white magic, but also a master of a secret magic art called ... Wizorb !

Control your magic wand to guide Cyrus and to cast magic spells in order to destroy obtacles and enemies that threaten the land. Earn gold to purchase supplies on your quest or help the grief stricken villagers rebuild their homes.

Travel to many strange places from the derelict monster infested town of Clover to Gorudo Castle atop Cauldron peak. Danger lurks around every corner so you'll need to keep your wins about you and have quick reflexes in order to survive.

Source: The Game Website.

112680.name: Marvels of Science and Steampunk
112680.description:
From the back of the book:
Science: The great marvel of the Age! Whereas magic is the domain of the aristocracy, maintaining their lives of luxury and social prominence, it is an expensive and unpredictable affair, and available only to a select few. The wonders of Steam and the new Science, however, extend their promise to everyone. From ironclad steamships to personal ornithopters—from electric telegraphs to Babbage engines—the marvels of this age will surely transform the world!

And with a little magic thrown in, who knows what else they will accomplish?

Marvels of Science and Steampunk explores the great wonders of the Victoriana world, building on the many inventions and technologies covered in the Victoriana Second Edition Core Rulebook—and introducing a few more.

Marvels of Science and Technology contains:

• Rules for designing and building technological marvels

• New character options for engineers

• Expanded rules for vehicles and vehicular combat

• New spells and medium abilities that affect technology

• Dozens of ready-made technological marvels to insert into your Victoriana campaign

112681.name: The Princess of Sundara
112681.description:
The dragon Rinjin has kidnapped the very smart princess Ehimaya from the palace of Sundara. Children will be chasing the dragon to rescue the princess in a wild adventure that will test all of their math's and logic skills.

Material covered in this Monkey Tales adventure:
• Addition - from 'up to 5' to 'up to 20' with or without regrouping
•Subtraction - from 'up to 5' to 'up to 20' with or without regrouping
•Adding and subtracting from 'up to 5' to 'up to 20' with or without regrouping
• Add up to 10
• Bigger than and smaller than with values less than 10
• Bigger than and smaller than with values less than 15
• Bigger than and smaller than with values less than 20
• Divide up to 10
• Add up to 20
• Understanding Tens (T) and units (U)
• T+U and U+T without regrouping
• T-U without regrouping
• TU+U en U+TU without regrouping
• TU+U and U+TU and TU-U without regrouping
• TU-TU and T-T without regrouping
• TU-TU without regrouping
• TU-TU and T-T en TU-U without regrouping
• What comes before and after...
• Counting by twos and fives
• Half and double of
• Divide in equal parts
• Understanding numbers up to 100
• Even and odd numbers up to 100
• Addition with multiples of 10 up to 100
• Subtraction with multiples of 10 up to 100
• Addition and subtraction with multiples of 10 up to 100

Source: The Game Website.

112682.name: The Museum of Anything
112682.description:
Carmen Pranquill, a huge dinosaur, has taken over the museum. No one dares enter anymore and children will need to devise a clever way to defeat the dinosaur that will tax all of their math and logic skills.

Material covered in this Monkey Tales adventure:
• Tens and units
• Understanding times/multiplied by
• Understanding tenths
• Understanding hundreds
• Even or odd up to 100
• Divide into equal parts
• Multiplication tables from 2 up to 10
• Division tables from 2 up to 10
• Understanding numbers up to 100
• Addition with 1 multiple of 10 up to 100
• Subtraction with 1 multiple of 10 up to 100
• Addition and subtraction with 1 multiple of 10 up to 100
• Addition with up to 3 multiples of 10 up to 100
• Subtraction with up to 3 multiples of 10 up to 100
• Addition and subtraction with up to 3 multiples of 10 up to 100
• Addition and subtraction up to 100 without regrouping
• Addition TU+U up to 100 with regrouping
• Subtraction TU+U up to 100 with regrouping
• Addition and subtraction TU+U up to 100 with regrouping
• Addition TU+TU up to 100 with regrouping
• Subtraction TU+TU up to 100 with regrouping
• Addition and subtraction TU+TU up to 100 with regrouping

Source: The Game Website.

112683.name: The Abbey of Aviath
112683.description:
The abbey of aviath was built in one night, and the evil witch Angelle Libelle has made it her residence. Using her foul powers, she has organized a veritable run on mankind's knowledge base, and children will need to use all of their logic and maths skills to defeat the evil witch.

Material covered in this Monkey Tales adventure:
• Addition and subtraction up to 100 with and without regrouping
• All multiplication tables up to 9
• All division tables up to 9
• Understanding tens
• Understanding numbers up to 1000 with H, T and U
• Addition up to 1000 with and without regrouping (respectively with Th, H, T and U)
• Subtraction up to 1000 with and without regrouping (respectively with Th, H, T and U)
• Addition and subtraction up to 1000 with and without regrouping
• Divide HT up to 1000
• Taking fractions using multiplication tables
• Division with remainders with known multiplication tables
• Division with remainders
• Multiplication and division by 50 and 100
• Multiplication and division up to 1000 with intermediate steps
• Multiplication and division with and without tables up to 1000
• Multiplication and division up to 1000 with intermediate steps
• Taken fractions without tables up to 1000
• Equality
• Addition and subtraction with up to 3 numbers
• Addition and subtraction up to 10000
• Addition with 3 numbers up to 10000
• Addition up to 0.1
• Subtraction up to 0.1

Source: The Game Website.

112684.name: The Castle of Draconion
112684.description:
Draconion, an very special type of vampire, had made it his goal to steal of all knowledge from mankind. Children will need all of their courage, math and logic skills to infiltrate in his castle and defeat the evil vampire.

Material covered in this Monkey Tales adventure:
• Addition up to 20 with regrouping
• Addition and subtraction up to 1000 with and without regrouping (Th, H, T, U)
• All Multiplication tables (2-9)
• All Division tables (2-9)
• Addition and subtraction up to 10 000
• Multiplication and division up to 10 000
• Fractions of numbers up to 10 000
• Addition with up to 3 numbers up to 10 000
• Addition and subtraction up to 100 000
• Multiplication and division up to 100 000
• Fractions of numbers up to 100 000
• Addition up to 0.1
• Subtraction up to 0.1
• Addition up to 0.01
• Subtraction up to 0.01
• Addition and subtraction of fractions with like denominators
• Bigger than and smaller than with fractions
• Addition and subtraction up to 200 000

Source: The Game Website.

112685.name: The Valley of the Jackal
112685.description:
In this ultimate Monkey Tales adventure, children will need to face their biggest threat yet -– the Egyptian god Wepwawet. Using all of their maths and logic abilities, they'll need to venture deep into the desert, into underground temples to face and defeat Wepwawet.

Material covered in this Monkey Tales adventure:
• Addition and subtraction up to 1000 with and without regrouping
• All Multiplication tables (2-9)
• All Division tables (2-9)
• Addition and subtraction up to 10 000
• Multiplication and division up to 10 000
• Addition and subtraction up to 100 000
• Multiplication and division up to 100 000
• Addition and subtraction up to 200 000
• Equality of fractions, percent and decimals
• Percent of 'simple' integers
• Percent of 'simple' decimals
• Find the equivalent fractions
• Addition and subtraction of fractions with like denominators
• Division of fractions by integers
• Using the four operations with fractions after reducing them to the same denomination
• Addition up to 0.1
• Subtraction up to 0.1
• Multiplication up to 0.1
• Division up to 0.1
• The four operations up to 0.1
• Addition up to 0.01
• Subtraction up to 0.01
• Multiplication up to 0.01
• Division up to 0.01
• The four operations up to 0.01
• Taking fractions of integers
• Taking fractions of decimals
• Taking fractions of integers and decimals
• Multiplication of simple fractions
• Multiplication and division of fractions

Source: The Game Website.

boardgameintegration: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Melee at Murdershroom Marsh
Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Rumble at Castle Tentakill
Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Melee at Murdershroom Marsh
Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Rumble at Castle Tentakill
boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
112686.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Did you know that magical wizards are battling to the death ... and beyond ... right now!? "Why battle?" you might ask. "What have I got to prove, magic man?" Only who's the most awesomely powerful battle wizard in the entire realm, that's what! As a Battle Wizard, you'll put together up to three spell components to craft millions (okay, not really) of spell combos. Your spells might kick ass, or they could totally blow – it's up to you to master the magic. You will unleash massive damage on the faces of your wizard rivals in a no-holds-barred, all-out burn-down to be the last Battle Wizard standing. And it doesn't stop there! Powerful magic items bring on a whole new level of bloody carnage as you and your mighty wizard opponents tear each other limb from limb in an orgy of killing! Do you have what it takes to use epic spells in a war at Mt. Skullzfyre? Will YOU be the Ultimate Battle Wizard!?!

Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Duel at Mt. Skullzfyre is a humorous card game depicting a vicious, over-the-top battle between a variety of comically illustrated wizards. The game focuses primarily on creating three-part spell combos to blast your foes into the afterlife. The unique Dead Wizard cards allow players to stay in the game even after their wizards have been defeated.
112686.name: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Duel at Mt. Skullzfyre
boardgamefamily: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards
boardgamepodcastepisode: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Duel at Mt. Skullzfyre
Episode 3 - Dead Heat, Cryptozoic Reviews, and Giveaway 2
The Gaming Gang Episode 42: Disaster on Kangchenjunga, Wu Xing RPG, Epic Spell Wars, Phoenix Comicon, 10 Rules to Better Con Going, and More!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 81

112687.name: Zen Puzzle Garden
112687.description:
User Summary

You are a monk, raking a Zen [puzzle] garden. You must rake lines into every bit of the sand, without treading on the beautiful lines you have already raked.

112688.description:
The war is over. Humanity has regained control. The zombies have been rounded up and contained. Time for people to get on with their lives. But there's no TV; no internet; society needs time to rebuild. What will the masses do for entertainment?

Zombie Roller Derby. In this game, you take the role of a roller derby team manager. Your team consists of "trained" zombies; your goal is to win the race, and maybe kill a few zombies along the way.

Race your zombies along the derby track. Play cards to urge them forward or to fight other zombies. Avoid the ire of the crowd, or stir them up on purpose. Play to win; to kill zombies; or to incite a riot. Just don't let the zombies get out of their cages...
112688.name: Zombie Roller Derby

112689.name: Jasper's Journeys
112689.description:
User Summary

Jasper's Journeys is a side-scrolling, cute fantasy platformer, with hidden locations to explore, golden globes to retrieve, and enemies to shoot. Your ammunition is purple fruit that you collect, so you must manage your resources as you hop about, wending your way to the blue dragon.

112690.name: Zeppelin: Giants of the Sky
112690.description:
User Summary

A simulation of economics and empire building based on historical potentials of airships.

112691.name: Pathfinder Society Special: Blood Under Absalom
112691.description:
From the publisher's website:

Pathfinder Society Special designed for Levels 1–11.

The Ruby Phoenix Tournament is nigh, and organizations and individuals throughout the Inner Sea are scrambling to secure a spot in the legendary Tian fighting competition, among them the Pathfinder Society. In an underground qualifier event overseen by an enigmatic old monk and his oni spokesman, the Pathfinders must overcome the opposition to ensure the Society can send representatives to distant Goka to compete in the Ruby Phoenix Tournament itself. Battles will rage and blood will flow under the streets of Absalom, and only the greatest combatants will emerge victorious.

This special is designed for play in Pathfinder Society Organized Play, but can easily be adapted for use with any world. It is a single scenario played by multiple tables simultaneously (minimum 5) and requires one GM per table and an overseer GM to coordinate the entire event. This special is compliant with the Open Game License (OGL) and is suitable for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

112692.description:
The new Goblin chiefs are ready to sound the charge and assault the castle! This time, the fortress is defended by a moat full of muddy water, but our fearless heroes did not come unprepared! Among the Goblin warriors are lifeguards, rafts, divers, fishermen, and even a pedal-boat – and they will all be needed to face the hazards (as well as the monsters!) hidden under the waters defending the castle! There are plenty of heroes of every kind, but this does not assure victory, especially when a fray erupts among the Goblins in the middle of the battlefield! But at the very end, there will be just one cry: Goooooobliiiiiiins!!!

Coming from the unleashed minds of 4G, Goblins: Epic Death, a fast-paced "card 'n' luck" game, is a new chapter in the saga of our green-skinned little friends. Victory is at hand, and the castle is ready for capture: Both are just an "epic death" away from you! So toss your Goblins, cross your fingers, and pray they all die. That way, victory will be yours!
112692.name: Goblins: Epic Death

112693.name: Wind-Up Knight
112693.description:
User Summary

Wind-up Knight is a platform game with 3-d graphics. Players control a toy wind up knight that runs nonstop through a series of enemy-infested obstacle courses. Players have buttons to make the knight jump, roll, swing his sword, or hold his shield over his head, but they cannot make him stop running! As the game progresses the levels become increasing difficult, requiring more complex maneuvers to make it through.

The first portion of the game is free; later portions of the game can be purchased with tickets, which can be paid for or can be earned through in-game achievements. In addition there are in-game items (swords, shields, etc.) that give the player extra powers and make the game easier. It is possible, but extremely difficult, to earn and beat the whole game solely through skillful play.

112694.name: Hockey Blast Pro Hockey Game
112694.description:
HOCKEY BLAST is an "old-school" card-chart-and-dice simulation of pro hockey. Primarily designed as a solitaire game for sports board game hobbyists, it can also be played head-to-head, with each player making decisions for his team. It was introduced by PLAAY Games in April of 2010.

The game differs significantly from similarly-themed hockey games in a number of ways.

First, it re-creates hockey action totally differently than existing games like APBA and Strat-O-Matic. Rather than re-creating a hockey game pass-by-pass and shot-by-shot, HOCKEY BLAST re-creates the action minute-by-minute. The game charts crystallize each minute's action, and a unique "lull" mechanism allows the gamer to fast-forward past uneventful minutes. The result is a hockey game that plays quickly, yet captures all the nuances and excitement of real hockey.

Second, HOCKEY BLAST realistically incorporates momentum and fights into the game play. In HOCKEY BLAST, a team plays better when it has momentum. It can gain momentum in a number of ways--by landing a big hit, scoring a goal, making a spectacular save, or having one of its players win a fight. In other hockey games, fights can occur, but have no real effect on the game other than to send participants to the penalty box. In HOCKEY BLAST, the classic hockey "enforcer" persona has a real role, just as in real hockey.

Another way HOCKEY BLAST is different is that it provides fans with instructions on how to rate their own players and teams. The company encourages this, and even posts user-created card sets for free download on its website, www.plaay.com.

The game comes in a two-piece labeled box with a game book that contains all the necessary charts, a hockey rink game board, a set of strategy cards, dice, markers for momentum and penalties, an instructions booklet, scoresheets, and two sample teams. Full player card sets based on historical pro hockey seasons are available, along with a fictional player card series that is updated annually.

112695.name: Game of Voyage Round the World
boardgameversion: Milton Bradley Ship on the cover edition
112695.description:
This game is a roll-and-move game with wonderful graphics on the gameboard (world map) and especially interesting for collectors on the box cover: It shows a large Zeppelin waiting to be tossed into its hangar.
It's supposed to be the so called "Reparations - Zeppelin" LZ 126, which obviously inspired the artist to draw this box cover

112696.name: Iron Aces
112696.description:
Iron Aces is a WWII flight simulation video game developed by Marionette and published by Xicat Interactive for the Dreamcast. It was released in Japan on June 29, 2000, in North America on February 6, 2001, and in Europe on June 29, 2001.

Source: Wikipedia, "Iron Aces", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112697.name: GB Racers
112697.description:
From the designers website:

A fast racing car game for 1 - 6 players, where you have 2 racing cars each & must get 77 points or more to win the GB championship. This you do by picking up points for both cars during several GB grand prix races. Each race takes 12 - 20 minutes to complete & there is an average of 4 - 5 races per championship.
The overall time averages just over 1 hour.

112698.description:
Sorrow of Salilth is a microgame for one or two players lasting about 20 minutes. When playing a 2 player game, one player assumes the role of the Council of Wardens, trying to defend the city of Salilth from the servants of the Grayking and close four barrier gates within the city. If the four gates are closed or all of the Servant units are defeated, Salilth is saved and the Warden Player wins.

The other player controls the forces of the Grayking trying to overwhelm Salilth and reach the Citadel of the Wardens where they attempt to place 10 Siege Corruption tokens within the Citadel, If they are successful, or can defeat all of the Warden Units, Salilth is lost and the Grayking Player wins.

When playing the solitaire variant, the player assumes the Council of Wardens role.

Needed: one 2-page hex map, 1 rule sheet, 1 unit counter sheet and 1 sheet of nomograph tables.

Setup: The Warden Player places all of their units inside the Citadel, stacked by type.
The player should also take the 4 Barrier Gate tokens, placing them within reach. They then place the marker on the Sparkblades icon on the Spell Rondel.

The Grayking Player divides their units into 6 stacks each with 6 unit counters. These stacks may be configured as desired by the player. They then place one stack on each of the 6 numbered zones outside the city. The player should also take the 10 Siege Corruption Tokens, placing them within reach.

Play: Each round of the game has 4 phases: Movement, Combat, Damage, Siege. Then a new round begins. The Grayking Player always goes first each phase, followed by the Warden Player.

Win: If all 4 gates are closed or all of Servant units are defeated, Salilth is saved and the Warden Player wins. If 10 Siege Corruption tokens are placed in the Citadel or all Warden Units are defeated, the Grayking Player wins.

Solitaire Variant: At game start, randomly sort the Grayking units into the 6 stacks of 6 units each, and place each stack randomly on each of the 6 numbered starting zones. During the Movement Phase, the player will move the Grayking units based on the rules as outlined above. Movement will always occur towards the Citadel and units will always form a larger group if there is a path choice. When splitting 4 or more units, always move units in order of the largest Spirit Strength first. During the Siege Phase, one Siege Corruption Token is added each round as long as any Servant unit occupies the Citadel.

This game uses nomographs instead of look-up tables and was designed to use a minimum number of components.

Sorrow of Salilth is a prequel to the Print and Play game - Shadows Upon Lassadar. A further game - Revenge of the Raven Consort - will complete the game trilogy.

Winner of the 2011 BGG Microgame contest
112698.name: Shadows Upon Lassadar: Sorrow of Salilth

112699.name: Ordbävning
112699.description:
A game published in junction with the student carnival "Lundakarnevalen 2010". The game is a word-game, where players try to descibe words without mentioning specifics (very similar to Alias).

Players take turn to try to describe the words on the card, each one with a specific theme, without mentioning the specific word or part of the word. The other players, teammates or opponents depending on the variant, try to guess as many as possible in a set period of time; and players score accordingly. First one to a set target of points is the winner.

What sets the game apart from Alias is the distinct tongue-in-cheek "lundahumor", i.e. humour from the student city of Lund. The themes and words on the different cards are often odd, screwball or intergroup.

In addition to the original rules, several variants is included in the base-game.

112700.name: Wall of the Dead
112700.description:
"They are hungry!
The only way to safety is to climb up. . . or is it?"

Dexterity based game in which your zombies are trying to reach the human of the other player. Be careful, or your zombies will tumble down and they'll have to make their way up again.

Game is simple: On the player's turn he or she gets a randomised zombie which must be placed against the opponent's wall. The goal is to get the pile high enough to touch the human. Players place one zombie at the time and try to catch the opponent's human before their own human is zombie food.

112701.name: Scoregasm
112701.description:
Scoregasm is a top down shooter.

The game is set in a little galaxy made up of a network of different levels, which you progress through in a non-linear fashion, opening up new routes and levels depending on how well you play. There's multiple endings too!

Source: The Developer Website.

112702.name: Diddls Käsekuchenland-Spiel
112702.description:
Objective: Collect as many cheese cake pieces as possible by moving around the board
- moving/acting by turn -
each player has to collect cheese cake pieces for Diddle. You can achieve this if you have to draw a question card => give the right answer or
if you draw an action card => perform required action properly
If all players are back in Diddls' cave the one who gained most of the pieces wins

112703.name: King's Bounty: Warriors of the North
videogameexpansion: King's Bounty: Warriors of the North – Ice and Fire
112703.description:
King’s Bounty: Warriors of the North is the next chapter in the cult RPG/adventure saga. The new tale takes place in the familiar world of Endoria featured in the previous games, but begins in the Viking lands, which the celebrated hero Bill Gilbert never visited during his famous quest in King’s Bounty: The Legend.

The Mighty Olaf, son of the Konung of Northlings, has dedicated his life to battling the undead who have infested the northern lands of Endoria. He seeks to liberate the snowy wastes, dwarven dungeons, and the very heart of Endoria, the kingdom of Darion itself, from the dark grip of necromancy. On his quest towards immortal glory he will encounter cunning foes and new friends, hard battles and amazing adventures.

The new game features:

- the new Viking race;
- new hero companions;
- new lands to explore;
- a new school of magic;
- new creatures, skills, awards and achievements.

Source: http://www.kingsbountygame.com/game/description.

112704.name: African Animal Hunt
112704.description:
Rules for game: First, place the animals (Elephant, Alligator, Camel, Zebra, Lion and Goat) on the board using set up rules , then 1st player rolls dice and then can do any of 3 things.

1) Place hunter on the board and then move him the total of both dice

or

2) place hunter on board move him total of 1 die then place second hunter on board and move him total of 2nd die

or

3) start hunter move him total of 1 die then place peg on board horizontally or vertically the distance away from hunter equal to the 2nd die.

Object of the game is to continue to make those die rolls and try and to surround the animals. Game ends when all animals have been caught. Scoring is as follows: Elephant, Alligator and Camel= 4 points. Zebra and Lion = 3 points and Goat = 2 points.

112705.name: Geopolitique 1990
112705.description:
User Summary:

You play the U.S. while the computer play Russia in this economic, political & military game of world dominance. By Bruce Ketchledge

112706.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 6 No 2 - Summer 2042)
112706.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," 10 O'clock News, Convention Calendar, Movie Releases, Duelling Ideas, Questionnaire Results, In the Arena, On the Track, European Report, Duel Slang, Combat Rock, The Showroom, Local Hero, Nuts & Bolts, & Closing Fire.

112707.description:
User Summary

Slapjack is a simple children's boardgame that appears to be related to, but distinct from, the Slap Jack card game...

At the beginning of the game all 44 cards are dealt face down to the players. (These are kept face down during the course of the game.) Players use a spinner to move cardboard pawns around a board. Each space has an instruction for the player to follow. Some spaces ask players to perform physical actions (which have no real effect on game play). Some spaces ask players to give or take cards from other players. This is significant because the object of the game is to collect all the cards. If you run out of cards you are eliminated.

There are a few strategically placed Slapjack spaces on the board. If someone lands on one of these spots, then each player takes a card at random (again all cards are kept face down at all times) and puts it in the center of the board. If someone puts down a Slapjack card, then the first player that slaps the card wins the hand.

There is a variant game listed in the rules where players use just the game cards and play a single card down one at a time. If a Slapjack card is played, then the first player to slap the card wins the hand. The last player with any cards wins. (This is essentially the Slap Jack card game, albeit with a smaller than standard deck.)
112707.name: Slapjack

112708.name: Straddle
112708.description:
Straddle is a skill-action party game played on a giant planisphere (5 ft x 6 ft plastic playing mat) and combines a fun mix of practical and observational astronomy. Playing like Hasbro’s classic Twister game, the object is to touch a star or constellation using only your feet or hands and be the last player not to touch any other body part to the mat.

Each player stands at a corner of the mat in socks or bare feet. The umpire spins the spinner and calls out the body part and the star or constellation, for example, left hand Orion. The first player puts his or her left hand on the constellation Orion. Using the supplied star charts, the umpire can help a player determine what stars are in the constellation. Play continues to the next player.

If a player touches the mat with any body part except a hand or a foot, that player is eliminated. Be the last player not to touch any other body part to the Straddle mat to win the game.

112709.name: Meet The Robinsons
112709.description:
From the Box Description:

Save The Robinson Time Machine!

-Play as Wilbur on over 40 new missions - beyond the movie!

-Activate cool gadgets to battle villains

-Challenge opponents in the action-packed Charge Ball mini-game

112711.name: Bolotudu
112711.description:
An abstract game on a 5x6 grid of African origin. It is similar to Dara with a few exeptions.

Each player has 12 pieces (stones, bids, etc.) of his colour. During initial set-up players take turns to place their pieces on empty squares of the board, two pieces (one piece in Dara) at a time. They must avoid 'three in a row' orthogonally during this phase.

In the second phase players move their pieces to adjacent squares trying to form 'three in a row' (diagonals don't count). After making 'three in a row' a player removes an enemy piece which is adjacent to either side of this row (that's another difference to Dara). A player loses the game when only 2 pieces of his colour remain on the board.

112712.name: The Wonderful End of the World
112712.description:
From the Publisher / Developer Website:

The Earth is about to be eaten. It’s your job to take as much as you can and create a new world to replace it.

112713.name: Mickey's Speedway USA
112713.description:
Box Description:

Buckle up and Get Ready to Race!

Rally across America with Mickey and friends! Race around 20 All-American courses--from Alaska to the Everglades--as you try to track down the Weasels and rescue poor dognapped Pluto. Use Ludwig Von Drake's wacky weapons--such as the "Antigrav-o-Kit Magno Flyer" or the "Stormy Weather Whenever Engager"--to give you the edge. Then blast past your friends, and listen as the drivers taunt each other using Disney's original character voices!

-Mickey Mouse in his own kart-racing game! It's kooky kart action, complete with crazy courses, wacky weapons--and Mickey Mouse!

-All your favorite Disney characters! Play as Mickey, Minnie, Donald, Daisy, Goofy or Pete--plus discover additional hidden characters.

-Madcap multiplayer modes! Up to 4 players can race on 20 different courses or compete in 4 different Battle Mode arenas.

112714.name: Monopoly (Sega Master System)
videogameversion: North American Sega Master System edition
112714.description:
Box Description:

Welcome to the original real estate trading game where everything brings you the same action, fun and excitement as the MONOPOLY board game.

112715.name: Grimrules
112715.description:
Introduction
This installment of GrimRules comes in three parts: Part 1 (Characters), Part 2 (Game Rules), and GrimTables.

112716.name: SUPERS! Comic Book Role Playing Game (Core Rules & Sourcebook)
112716.description:
From the introduction:

What’s IT ABOUT?
Supers! is a game all about playing costumed heroes- the kinds of hero you see in good old-fashioned comic books. These heroes are larger than-life; they have high ideals and they know right from wrong. Their world is black-and-white; they are good and the villains are bad. There are no real grey areas. Their cause is justice, liberty and freedom. They seek to protect the weak and defend the common man. Most are loved by all; some are misunderstood and don’t get the adoration they feel they deserve. But regardless, they strive to do the right thing and aim to make a difference.

NOW INCLUDES THE SUPERS! SOURCEBOOK ALL INTEGRATED INTO ONE PDF

112717.name: Great Ork Gods
112717.description:
Introduction
Great Ork Gods is a roleplaying game of rampaging Orks and their malignant Gods. Unlike many other roleplaying games, Great Ork Gods is designed to be played for an evening and then forgotten about. Don’t take it too seriously; it’s not that kind of a game. Great Ork Gods was designed with having four players (plus the GM) in mind, I know it works well with three, and I suspect five or six could still work well but you’ll probably have
trouble with two players, and one player just plain won’t work.

112719.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 6 No 3 - Fall 2042)
112719.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," 10 O'clock News, Convention Calendar, Movie Releases, Duelling Ideas, Gaming News, Duel Slang, Combat Rock, The Showroom, Submissions, Local Hero, Cube Logs, & Closing Fire.

112722.name: Ataque Pirata
112722.description: After the retirement of captain "White Beard", the crew of a pirate ship decides do rotate positions. Each round, a new player becomes captain and pick roles for everybody else. In order, the pirates take a treasure (pearls, diamonds, rubys, emeralds or rum barrels) from a hand of cards. Precious stones translate into victory points and rum barrels confer "special powers" to the players who hold them. But not all treasures will be banked safely - Spanish, French and English pirate-hunters will force the crew to discard some cards along the game.

112723.name: Space HoRSE
112723.description:
User Summary

A PC reworking of the Atari 8-bit classic, MULE, an economic science fiction game. While MULE was an acronym for Mobile Utility Element, Space Horse was an acronym for Holistic Robot Slave Engineer.

112724.name: G.P.A.
112724.description:
Introduction
G.P.A. is a sci-fi/fantasy/horror roleplaying game about surviving university; it may be black comedy, or may just be telling it like it is, it's hard to know the difference anymore. This is not just any university, but university after the floodgates of magic and weird science are opened upon the world; university after everyone signs a liability waiver, and no more than half of all university students survive to graduation.

112725.name: Nightmessenger (Vol 6 No 4 - Winter 2042)
112725.description:
User Summary

The Black Arm-Band Issue

In this issue: Opening Fire, NOVA Works, The World "Out There," 10 O'clock News, NOVA Overview, Dueling Ideas, Movie Releases, Convention Calendar, In the Arena, Focus: Nightmessenger Edition, The Showroom, OMEN Member Profile, Return Fire, Security Alert, & Closing Fire.

112726.name: G.P.A. 24-Hour Edition
112726.description:
Introduction
G.P.A. is a "24-Hour Role-Playing Game". I started working on it at 1am, Sunday, April 16th, 2000. After sleeping a few hours near dawn, I continued working on it, and was finished just before midnight on the 16th.

G.P.A. is a sci-fi/fantasy/horror roleplaying game about surviving university; it may be black comedy, or may just be telling it like it is, it's hard to know the difference anymore. This is not just any university, but university after the floodgates of magic and weird science are opened upon the world; university after everyone signs a liability waiver, and no more than half of all university students survive to graduation.

112727.name: The Bomb
112727.description:
Introduction
The Bomb uses the Shrouded Agendas: The Purifiers system. Each player will need 2d6, a pencil, a blank character sheet or two (the mortality rate is fairly high), a warm radioactive glow, and at least one person should have percentile dice.

112728.name: Bloodsuckers
112728.description:
Introduction
Anyone who knows their vampire flicks knows that vampires aren't supposed to whinge on like Louis from Interview With The Vampire, they're supposed to run around drinking their victims dry, shooting each other, and hiding from the sun, and at the end of the film the humans always stake or burn all the vampires. That'd be the whole POINT of playing a bloodsucker - to live as hard and fast as you can before you're Really Dead.

112729.name: The Alan Smithee Project
112729.description:
Introduction
Alan Smithee is the nom de guerre of directors and screenwriters who have had their movies released in a form they did not intend or approve of; when this happens, they have their names replaced with "Alan Smithee", which is an anagram for "The Alias Men". The Alan Smithee Project (TASP) is a roleplaying game of movies that should not be; bad crossovers, bad sequels, bad adaptations, bad remakes, and even bad new movies, they're all grist for this mill.

112730.name: The DUDE Game System
112730.description:
Introduction
Diceless:
DUDE uses regular playing cards for task resolution instead of the dice common in other games, and by holding different-sized hands, each player has more or less control over the results of their actions, rather than being at the mercy of blind chance.
Universal:
DUDE can theoretically represent any genre. However, it does work best at fast action-adventure stories or freeform dramatic gaming; complex mechanical simulation of a world is not within DUDE's abilities.
Determination:
DUDE uses a unified task system to handle all actions. And unlike other (overly-complex) games, it doesn't waste your time trying to remember which stat affects a task.
Engine:
DUDE is only the basic mechanics of an RPG - you will need to acquire or write a setting book. See The Alan Smithee Project for an example of what needs to be developed in such a book.

112731.name: Malevolence
112731.description:
Introduction
There's no such things as monsters. No monsters of magical origin, anyway. Ghosts, demons, zombies, these are all fantasies created by primitive minds, and only fools believe in that kind of nonsense anymore. But magic isn't the only source of monsters. Humans can be monsters to each other, from Jeffrey Dahmer to Adolf Hitler. We can create entirely new monsters with the normally benevolent sciences of robotics and genetic engineering. There are animals, plants, and diseases known and unknown inimical to humanity. And space is vast; somewhere out there are people and animals who have not yet discovered us, and their survival will be more important than our survival to them. The universe stands against us, often not out of intentional malevolence, but simply because it does not care if we live or die.

Malevolence is a roleplaying game set in a world where some of these monsters are real. You might be innocent civilians threatened by these hazards, or professional or independent agents attempting to investigate and contain them, or you may be responsible for them in the first place. You'll investigate strange occurrences and attempt to survive them. You're probably going to die...

112732.name: DUDEHack
112732.description:
Introduction
The land of Dudania was once peaceful, safe, and gentle, with no more than the usual level of religious persecution and torture, racial intolerance, unjust executions, bloody warfare, and lack of proper hygeine typical to a world in the grips of pulp literary medievalism.

Six months ago, three meteors fell to the earth, and from each crawled a Dungeon Lord: Yecnad Nayr the Annoying, Nostrebor Tap the Unholy, and the most foul Setag Lib the Devourer of Worlds. They slaughtered and ate all who came to loot the corpes see if someone needed help, then burrowed into the ground to establish their nightmarish lairs...

Now, monsters swarm from the dungeons, spawned by the Dungeon Lords, and they are increasing in numbers and power. Brave heroes are needed to enter these dungeons and slay the Dungeon Lords. Are you worthy?

DUDEHack is a game set in the world of hack-and-slash swords and sorcery fantasy, but characters may or may not carry that out as the focus of the game. Completely ignoring the tropes of the genre and setting up businesses, settling down, and being law-abiding citizens is not an easy course, either, when the entire history of the genre conspires against you...

112733.name: Juegos olimpicos
112733.description: "Juegos olimpicos" (Olympic Games) is a game for the whole family, consisting of different Olympic events (marathon, long and high jump, hammer throw, sprint race...) wich take place in different boardgames, each with it's own rules and mechanics. After each event, the winners receive individual medals (gold, silver and bronze) and at the end of the Olympics, after having competed in all events (having played in all the boardgames), the one who has amassed the largest number of medals, taking into account its value (a gold medal is worth more than two bronze), is declared the winner.

112734.name: Empires And Generals
112734.description:
Empires and Generals is a Print and Play Collectible Card Game with free content available from EmpiresandGenerals.com.

You play as a famous Empire from real history against other Empires from real history using Generals, Soldiers, Ideals, Strategies, Tactics and Resources from their own unique Empire.

The object of Empires and Generals is to become the greatest and most powerful Empire. You can do this by gaining Cultural Health or by causing others to lose theirs.

To date the "Family Edition" is free to print and that includes:

The Huns
Roman Republic
Egyptian Kingdom
Ancient China

The Expanded Edition includes:

Ancient Greece
Achaemenid Persia
and more

And other expansions include:

Act of God Thematic Expansion
The Prince Thematic Expansion
The Great Plague

Using Playing Cards and Resource Cards you build your Empire. Build your Kingdom with Civilization-specific cards. Send your Soldiers out to the Battlefield with the General in the lead. Utilize Strategies and Tactics to suit your personal playing system.

Pick an Empire to represent.

After determining the length of game-play, dominate your opponent by destroying their army or hide behind your walls and win by cunning.

112736.name: Deadly Waves
112736.description:
From the publisher website:

Run on Water

More than two-thirds of the Earth’s surface is covered by water. That means that two-thirds of the Earth is covered in escape routes, infiltration points, and hiding places that people stuck on land constantly overlook. If you want to know how to use all that blue to your advantage, you need to know the boats that are out there, what they can do, and how your competition is putting them to use.

Deadly Waves collects information about thirty different watercraft, from the fast and agile Wave Cutter to the luxurious, self-maintaining Zeppelinwerke Elite Cruiser to the hulking yet surprisingly quick Maersk-Jorgenson Fast Freighter. Runners can use this book to gain all sorts of options for taking to the water, whether they’re planning a quick jaunt or embarking on a long voyage.

Deadly Waves is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary Edition.

112737.name: Unfriendly Skies
112737.description:
From the publishers website:

Wings to Fly

It’s a big world, and not all of the work that’s available is sitting right outside your front door. Sometimes you might need to hop across a country, across a continent, or across an ocean. Other times you might look to the air to find a way across a border that’s too tough to cross on the ground. And then there are the times you might need something in the air that can pack a much-needed punch.

Unfriendly Skies provides descriptions and game information for thirty-two aircraft, including the EuroWars-tested MiG-63, the slow but easy-to-overlook Skyswimmer, and the luxurious Platinum II. The book also includes information on the basics of air travel in 2073, including information on which paths you may or may not follow if you are trying to lay low.

Get your runners into the skies and moving fast with the options Unfriendly Skies provides. Unfriendly Skies is for use with Shadowrun, Twentieth Anniversary.

112738.name: Transalpin
112738.description:
Description:
Players control the fate of several regions in the Alpine arc (Rhône-Alpes, Piedmont, the cantons of Uri and Tessin, Tyrol, South Tyrol, Carinthia and Slovenia). Each two of these regions are connected by the Alpine crossings of Mt. Cenis/Fréjus, the Gotthard, the Brenner Pass and Karawanken. At each round, traffic increases. Within ten rounds, regions must try to contain the consequences of traffic by taking actions in the fields of economy, tourism and the environment as well as by implementing measures for transport regulation.

Aim of the game:
The player with the most intact region at the end of round 10 - that is, the player who has obtained the highest scores in Environment, Economy and Tourism and therefore has managed to govern the traffic volume - is the winner.

Course of the game:
The game is played over 10 rounds, in which the following three stages are repeated:
1. Drawing of traffic and event cards and execution of tasks
2. Investment of money
3. Determination of consequences.

Regions can invest only the money they have collected. Players can decide to impact on Tourism, Economy or the Environment and move the corresponding game piece of one field per money invested.
Also, they can play the action cards with traffic regulating measures. The prices for these actions are indicated on the corresponding cards. Some cards can only be played with other regions.
Other cards affect the traffic in neighboring regions and therefore these players must find the right countermeasures to control this new "unwanted" traffic otherwise the situation get`s out of control and the environment is ruined loosing many points.

112739.name: Líder (Número 8 - Diciembre 1988)
112739.description:
SUMARIO


El estado de la afición



Silencio se juega:
Aegean Strike




Plomo en las mesas



La voz de su Master



Módulos

112740.name: Líder (Número 10 - Abril 1989)
112740.description:
SUMARIO

Communikado
EL estado de la afición
Consultorio de Orco Francis
Silencio se juega:
Dossier
La voz de su Master
Módulo Cthulhu
Módulo RQ

112741.name: Líder (Número 20 - Diciembre 1990)
112741.description:
SUMARIO

EL estado de la afición
La Biblioteca de Ankh-Morpork
Consultorio de Orco Francis
Silencio se juega:
Harpoon
Turning point Stalingrad
Warhammer 40.000
Third Reich

Plomo en las mesas
Reglas de Asedio

El Correo del Zar
Diplomacy

Dossier
Panorama para jugar

La voz de su Master
Los duques del Caos
Los 7 roles malditos
Aquelarre
Los Jinetes de Rohan
Star Wars: nuevas razas

Módulos
La llamada de Cthulhu
Paranoia
RuneQuest
Príncipe Valiente
El Señor de los Anillos

112742.name: Líder (Número 22 - Marzo 1991)
112742.description:
SUMARIO

EL estado de la afición
La Biblioteca de Ankh-Morpork
Consultorio de Orco Francis
Silencio se juega:
Third Raich
Wrassling
Tablero de cristal
Flechas contra corazas

Plomo en las mesas
La batalla de Salamina

El Correo del Zar
Panzerkrieg por correo

Dossier
Diplomacia

La voz de su Master
Componentes mágicos

Módulos
Stormbringer
El Señor de los Anillos

112745.description:
Squava is a derivative of Yavalath with the same goal but different components. It is intended to be a small simple game.

It is played on a 5x5 square board. 2 players (White and Black) alternate turns placing a pawn of their colour on an empty space of the board.

Players strive to make a line of 4 pieces of their colour, but lose if they make a line of 3 before doing so. Lines can be orthogonal or diagonal.
112745.name: Squava

112746.name: Going to the Cinema
112746.description:
A simple game, rather like Snakes and Ladders but without snakes or ladders.

The board has 100 squares and the object is to be the first to reach square 100.

This must have been a free game sent by post because the board is paper and the teetotum needs to be cut out to act as the die. And you can cut out 'figures' for playing pieces.

112747.name: The Rescue of Princess Blobette
112747.description:
The Rescue of Princess Blobette follows the titular protagonists as they attempt to rescue Princess Blobette from her imprisonment from a castle tower. The game features the same puzzle-platforming gameplay mechanics as Trouble on Blobolonia. Controlling the boy, the player must feed the blob different flavored jelly beans to transform it into different tools to traverse the castle. The Rescue of Princess Blobette was designed and programmed by David Crane, who also created the original NES game.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Rescue of Princess Blobette," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112748.name: Wild Western
112748.description:
From the Game Manual:

WILD WESTERN Taito America Corporation’s WILD WESTERN game is a journey back in time to the Wild West. You will mount your fiery steed in pursuit of a gang of bandits and feel like a real western hero when all the bandits are shot down and the locomotive safely passes through the desert.

The horses speed and direction is controlled by the 8-Way Joystick. Directional gunfire is controlled by the Revolving Control hitting the Button the player fires at the runaway bandits. The Bandits gunfire, running into cacti, rocks, or train is fatal to the player.

When a Bandit hops on the train, the player must also climb aboard in order to shoot him. Getting aboard the train requires skill and timing as he must run parallel with the train at a safe distance and push the button to get aboard. The same is true when the player returns to his horse, he must wait for his horse to run alongside the train and time his jump in order to remount his horse.

Riding the train too long is also dangerous because the player must watch for outstretched waterpipes when passing by watertanks. The player must push the button to duck under the waterpipes or be knocked from the train.

The player gets a chance to improve his aim in the bonus frame hitting the coin tossed into the air by his horse. Double the Bonus for a hit, or the horse laughs when missed.
The game ends when the player has lost all of his sheriffs or when 3 bandits have hopped aboard the train.

An additional sheriff is added for scoring 30,000 points (adjustable).

112750.name: Boolean
112750.description:
Boolean is an abstract strategy game that uses the concepts of Boolean Logic to play. At first created as a learning tool by College Professor Edu Jacober, Boolean was published in 2011 by Ceilikan Jogos. It is now out of print.

Boolean is actually a game system and comes with two distinct sets of rules. The board represent a logic circuit with boolean operations that can be changed by playing cards on the game board.

Basic rules: Players are either black or white (0 or 1) and, by setting the logic gates on the game board, try to get their team to score more points. In your turn you can: a) buy a card, b)play a card. Circuit inputs are driven by a FIFO line

Advanced rules: Players are also either black or white and, by setting logic gates on the game board, try to get their team to score more points. In your turn you can: A) buy a card, b) play a card, c) feed a free input with a piece from your score track. Circuit inputs are copied from gameboard latches existent on more valuable locations in the gameboard.

112751.name: Harley Davidson & L.A. Riders
112751.description:
In Harley-Davidson & L.A. Riders, the player rides one of five Harley-Davidson models. The objective is to complete a series of checkpoints around Los Angeles under a time limit. The objective is similar to the later Sega arcade game, "Crazy Taxi" (1999).

There are five playable bike models in the game:

FLSTF Fat Boy
FL 1948 Panhead
FXDWG Dyna Wide Glide
Sportster 1200 Sport
FXRP Police Motorcycle

User note- Deluxe Arcade machines featured a miniature Fat Boy that was used as the controller.

Source: Wikipedia, "Harley-Davidson & L.A. Riders", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112752.name: Chocolate Castle
112752.description:
User Summary

In Chocolate Castle, you must see to all the different types of chocolate getting eaten. Each type of animal will eat precisely one specific type of chocolate. The trick is that after an animal eats a contiguous hunk of chocolate, the animal leaves, too. You work around this by sticking same types of chocolate together, by sliding them around from above. Problematically, once you set down two same-type pieces of chocolate, they stick together forever; this is where the puzzling comes in.

112754.name: Sateenvarjo-peli
112754.description:
Players try to repair holes in their umbrella before rain.
Each umbrella has 5 different colours, player throws a dice, if the dice shows a colour that player doesn't already have he gets to put a counter on that colour, if the dice shows grey a rain cloud is put on the table. When there are five rain clouds, the game ends. Any player who has got five different colours before that wins the game.

112755.name: Hornby Virtual Railway
112755.description:
From the rear of the case:
