A special branch of nanite research discovered a way to create nanites that could strongly interact with the atomic crystal lattice of metals, with the careful application of energy and force at a molecular level it was possible to give metals a degree of flexibility and resilience that had enormous potential. The result of the research was what became commercially know as 'flexible metals', and more advanced forms evolved into 'living metals' and 'liquid metals'.

112858.name: Aegyptus
112858.description:
Introduction
The Great God RA has left us. Tired of the squabbling of his children, the lesser gods, and his people, the mortals, he has retired to a higher place to contemplate what might be. RA himself no longer involves himself in the day to day dealings of the gods or the mortals, but a part of him remains, watching, returning each day as the Sun to keep an eye on things. At night though he rests and those things that might fear RA’s burning gaze venture forth.

112859.name: Vikings: Fields of Conquest
112859.description:
User Summary

A loosely-based historical simulation of medieval economics and conquest.

112860.name: Under the Ice
112860.description:
User Summary

A simulation of strategic anti-submarine warfare in the Arctic Ocean.

112862.name: Ultrabots
112862.description:
User Summary

Your robots (ultrabots) must defeat the enemy aliens seeking to conquer the Earth.

112864.name: Super Powers Unlimited
112864.description:
Website Description
Super Powers Unlimited allows unprecedented customization for your character, powers, and equipment. You won’t need to search through a long list of powers, weapons, or armors to find what you want. You create everything you need from scratch.

This game is 100% compatible with any genre, location, time period, or mix of all of the above! If you want to do a fantasy story, with magic and dragons and supernatural creatures - no problem. If you want to do a futuristic sci-fi adventure traveling through time and space - no problem. If you want to do a futuristic sci-fi adventure with magic and supernatural creatures - still no problem!

That’s the power of our game system. It uses basic rules and templates to allow you to create and customize whatever you need! It takes what’s in common with all those things and makes it possible to create whatever your imagination desires and requires.

That means you can have any super power you can imagine! You can be any kind of character you want! You can go anywhere, do anything, play what you want, where you want, when you want - unleash your imagination! Anything’s possible now!

112865.name: Exo Squad
112865.description:
User Summary

Exo Squad was based off the animated TV show and toys of the same name. Levels in the game vary between sidescrolling shooting, flight, and even fighting one-on-one against characters from the show.

Multiplayer was just the fighting portion. All characters had identical moves.

This game was exclusive to the Sega Genesis.

112866.name: Super Heroes and Heroines
112866.description:
Introduction
Who hasn’t read a Comic Book? Most of America’s children have read at least one Comic Book in their lifetime. Most Comics have Super Heroes / Heroines to do the adventures in the book. With the increasing human connection of these characters to normal life is becoming uncanny. Primarily Image Comics and Top Cow Comics are making characters that many people can relate to. Many of the DC and Marvel Heroes / Heroines have no real "home life". The books are primarily just watching them fight the monthly bad guy. Where as Top Cow and Image have
Heroes / Heroines that have a "real life". The writers give them hobbies, favorite bands, normal life problems, a very human quality to them. So I am wanting to capture some of that quality in this game. I mean, there is nothing wrong with the Bad Guy of the month idea. It should actually be used to make the game a bit more interesting. But each character should have some human qualities to them.

112867.name: Super Crusaders RPG (Second Edition)
112867.description:
Website Description
Super Crusaders Second Edition is a role playing game. Create your own superhero, or use your favorite hero from the comics, and adventure in a world created by you and your friends.

112868.name: Gamebook Adventures 7: Temple of the Spider Gods
112868.description:
Cesaro Cortez, a famed explorer-conquistador, set out three years ago on his last great expedition. His ships never returned to an Orlandrian port and he was feared lost until a mysterious cargo appeared recently in Miramar. The nature of this cargo will put Orlandes in jeopardy, sending you on an epic journey to find Cortez, save the country and face your darkest fear!

A newly written story by Jonathan Green, illustrated by Josh Wright.

Penned by acclaimed gamebook author Jonathan Green!
All newly updated interface makes gamebook reading even better than before!
Full color illustrations!
Real-time 3D dice rolling with realistic physics.
Easy to change fonts, font sizes, and paper type to set up the book the way you want it.
Character sheet that tracks your stuff as well as the clues you have found
Use bookmarks to save your progress helping you get past tricky sections.
Dozens of unique achievements to collect.
Try to find all of the images in the book!
Interactive world map which can be zoomed and scrolled.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112869.description:
Munchkin Apocalypse is a core set in the Munchkin series with an end of the world theme that includes natural disasters, zombie takeovers, Armageddon, alien invasions, nuclear war, etc. And while this is still a standard Munchkin game where you try to level up by killing the monsters, stealing the treasure, and stabbing your buddy, there's a new "Seal" mechanic that significantly changes the gameplay.

Seals are a reference to the biblical seals of the Apocalypse. They can be opened and closed, although it's typically more difficult to close them. Once seven Seals are open, the game ends immediately, and the player with the highest combat strength (excluding levels) is the winner. The Seal mechanic adds a sense of impending doom to the game, meant to mimic the sense of impending doom for a real apocalypse. It also tends to create situations where the group works together to close a Seal in order to prevent a player from winning via the Seal mechanic. So there is more teamwork than in a regular Munchkin game.

The balance of the deck is also different than the other Munchkin sets. There are a lot more Disaster cards, which are equivalent to traps and curses, so bad things tend to occur more frequently. Also, there are more monsters, especially high-level monsters. To offset this, however, there are more item enhancers and high-bonus items. It's been stated in the Munchkin forums that Munchkin Apocalypse is harder to play and is intended more for seasoned Munchkin veterans.

Munchkin Apocalypse has four new classes but does not have races, powers, or other "thingies". It includes Undead and Shark monsters, which follow special rules.

The game comes with 180 cards (92 Doors, 76 Treasures, 12 Seals). The Seal cards are a different size than the regular cards--they're square and are shorter but wider (2.75" x 2.75"). The included d6 is orange with lime green pips, similar in color to the orange dice in the +6 Bag o' Radioactive Munchkin d6.
112869.name: Munchkin Apocalypse

112870.name: Stray Bullet
112870.description:
Introduction
Stray Bullet is an action-filled roleplaying game in the technothriller genre. The term "technothriller" was coined in the eighties, largely because Tom Clancy's novels could not be placed into any existing category. Nowadays, a lot of authors write novels that belong to the the technothriller genre. Dale Brown, Stephen Coonts, Harold Coyle, Richard Herman Jnr, Steve Pieczneik (with Tom Clancy) and Patrick Robinson are all good examples of technothriller authors.

112871.name: Spaceship Traffic
112871.description:
User Summary

Guide spaceships into one of three loading docks according to color.

112872.name: JAWS Revenge
112872.description:
User Summary

Control the shark as he swims in the ocean devouring fish and swimmers as well as making him jump out of the water to attack boats, hang gliders and planes.

112873.name: Siege Hero
112873.description:
User Summary

Fire stones in an effort to knock down the fortress in this game reminiscent of Crush the Castle

112874.name: Leopard Women of Venus!
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode Sixty-Five – Experiencing Gencon 2011 and the Hex Games Interview
112874.description:
User summary.

A bizarre and wonderful world setting for the QAGS system, based on the works of cult cartoonist Fletcher Hanks. (NO, you probably haven't heard of him.)

From the publisher's website:

Venus is a hellish nightmare world of hideous monsters and savage barbarians, a world that can only be tamed by the Leopard Women. Armed with comet gun helmets, radium whips, and Flying Saurian mounts, the Leopard Women stand between the human settlers of Venus and total annihilation.

Leopard Women of Venus is a mind-melting pulp science fiction role-playing game inspired by the works of Fletcher Hanks. Hanks wrote and drew bizarre and memorable work in the earliest days of American comic books. His work is boldly drawn, frequently ugly, and strangely fascinating. Leopard Women of Venus gives you the tools you need to recreate the magic and lunacy of a Fletcher Hanks comic with your gaming group.

Leopard Women of Venus is designed for use with the QAGS Second Edition rules. It includes the history of Venus, including the story of how humans settled there and how it all went horribly wrong; an overview of the planet’s climate, terrain, and exotic locales; full descriptions of the human civilizations of Venus, from the caverns to the jungle; colorful monsters, like the Hypno-Shark, the Man-Eating Tree, and the Quivering Blood Gnats; and character creation guidelines, including rules for psychic powers. For the Game Master, there are sample PCs, a detailed guide to running the game, random tables, and a complete adventure, “Menace from Space!” It’s a combination that does everything but run the game for you.

112875.name: A Few Rare Men
112875.description:
This is a specialty ASL product that purportedly is available free from Critical Hit as a special thanks only to those who ordered the "Many Bundle" (which was a bulk order including the following CH products: GENESIS II + THE STONNE HEIGHTS + BdF II + GEMBLOUX II + FACING THE BLITZ).

A Few Rare Men features six France/Belgium 1940 ASL scenarios, and comes with a new geomorphic map board, a large overlay, and two small counter sheets.

112876.name: Stones
112876.description:
Introduction
The following is inspired by the collectable dice game and RPG, Throwing Stones. This RPG I've created is a perfect example of exactly the kind of thing I always complain about -- overly cute dice mechanics that add nothing (or less) to the quality of the game, but it is an interesting diversion.

112877.name: Europa-Spiel
112877.description:
Objective: trivia-game; move your stones (meeples) up to 'high scoring' positions
- moving by turn -
roll the die, select and move one of your stones, draw cards (if your stone enters scoring positions), reply on questions (if your stone crosses a question mark)
if you give an incorrect answer you have to move your stone into 'left' area, otherwise right (=better) area
you may 'kick' opponent's stones
if a stone reaches 'top level' all stones on lowest level are eliminated
game ends, if all remaining stones are placed on scoring positions

112878.name: Ammo Domini: Fight for Europe to the Last Bullet
112878.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

112880.name: Vorwärts, kleine Raupe!
112880.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line and became a butterfly
- moving by turn -
throw 2 dice - the coloured one shows, which caterpillar should be moved, the other die the corresponding number (1-3) of moves.
But because a caterpillar exists out of 3 parts - head, belly and duff, you must move them sequencing

112882.name: Calcul
112882.description:
CALCUL is the 1st boardgame credited to Rudi Hoffmann.

It's like most of his games one with easy to understand and to learn rules but including the special "Kick": Every player starts with two parts of a pyramid cut in half, and following a certain pattern on the gameboard tilting their pieces, they have to reunite these halves to form a complete pyramid on one the the square board fields.
The more players the more challenge, as the space to tilt your pyramid is limited...

The game was a special promotional item for a company doing promotion itself, and it was of immensly high production quality: The game box was a wooden one, the gameboard was printed on top of it and the the pyramid halves were made of wood covered with lacquered cardboard.

112883.name: Super Slap Shot
112883.description:
Super Slap Shot (スーパースラップショッ) is a traditional five-on-five ice hockey video game endorsed by 'Mr. Hockey' Gordie Howe. No licenses from real-life professional league are used. Thirty-two international teams are available to choose from in exhibition and tournament modes. These teams include the United States, Sweden, Russia, and Canada. There are more than ten pages of hockey stats to look up in a typical game. Realistic penalities are given and the fighting is given an up-close view.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Slap Shot", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112884.name: Super Solitaire
112884.description:
Super Solitaire - known as Trump Island (トランプアイランド Toranpuairando) in Japan - has a different variations version of the classic solitaire card game. These include: Klondike, FreeCell, Golf, Cruel, Pyramid, Stonewall, Doesn't Matter, Aces Up, Florentine, Poker, Canfield and Scorpion. Classic artwork for each game's background is included along with optional cartoony graphics. Soft music is included with each and every game variation. Players can even choose to get hints or even skip to the next card through a special options screen.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Solitaire", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112885.name: Super Strike Eagle
112885.description:
Super Strike Eagle, known in Japan as F-15 Super Strike Eagle (Ｆ－１５スーパーストライクイーグル F-15 Supa Sutoraiku Iguru), is a combat-oriented arcade video game.

This video game involves flying airplanes that tests the player's Sidewinder missile and machine gun firing skills against various non-aligned nations that were historically notorious for housing extremist leaders during the Cold War. The game was released in North America, Europe, and Japan approximately simultaneously.

There are various types of targets in the game, including air, land and water targets in an environment that gives players permission to freely roam around the battlefield; limited only by the player's fuel supply. Land targets include nuclear power plants (but often include anti-air weapons and tanks); the player may suffer from radiation sickness after destroying nuclear plants when not at a safe distance to do so. The player will eventually need to use one of his/her limited sorties to have it healed; neglecting to do so will have fatal results. Weapons in the game include guns, missiles, electronic jammers, and bombs. Each mission on every war theatre consists of both mandatory and optional targets.

Shooting the optional targets results in the accumulation of a higher score which can double as a respect meter for bragging rights. Furthermore, destroying airfields, although not necessarily required to complete a mission, would stop opposing fighters taking-off to take the player down. In the more advanced missions, players can shoot chemical weapons factories and terrorist camps for bonus points. Although the game cannot be saved through a video game battery, there are a number of passwords the player can use to resume his/her mission at the appropriate place. Crashing the airplane and being killed in action will result in the flags (located at the United Nations building in New York) being lowered to half-mast. Dying in the game will also produce the playing of Taps while the world mourns the deceased pilot.

There is a practice round and then the player is thrown into real-life combat zones in order to test the skills learned in the practice round. Targets become progressively difficult to destroy. Unlike most shooter games, the player only has one plane. If the player crashes, the game is over and a screen indicating the nations (if any) that were reclaimed by the player displays.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Strike Eagle", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112886.name: Cthulhu Zap
112886.description:
Dark forces are moving. Gates are opening all over the city, monsters are on the loose, and Cthulhu is starting to stir from his endless slumber. You need to close all the gates and kill all the monsters before Cthulhu wakes up and destroys everything.

This game is an attempt to make an express version of Arkham Horror. The primary game mechanic is a "Move/Effort" system, in which 2 eight-sided dice are rolled, and one is used for movement and the other for actions. Higher numbers are better for both, but be careful. Every time you roll doubles, you are one step closer to defeat.

The goal of the game is to completely remove the dark forces by closing all the gates and destroying all the monsters. Over the course of the game, various things (the biggest being rolling doubles at any time) cause the doom track to fill up. The players need to remove the dark forces before the track fills, or they all lose.

112887.name: Valis IV
112887.description:
Valis IV (ヴァリスⅣ Varisu Fō), or Super Valis IV (SUPERヴァリス赤き月の乙女 Sūpā Varisu Akaki Tsuki no Otome, or Red Moon Rising Maiden), (another alternative name was Super M'aider Maiden) on the Super Nintendo is a video game platformer and the final release of the Mugen Senshi Valis series in North America. Unlike its predecessors, it wasn't released on the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis in any form.

Following on the events of Valis III, Yūko has become the goddess of the world of Vecanti and has watched over the world in peace since the death of Glames. Trouble brews, however, when a prince of Vecanti named Galgear begins to search for a magical ring. This ring increases his powers, but to the loss of control he could have maintained under its effects, and the gods of Vecanti recognize this and enslave the reckless prince inside a crystal, its mass sinking into the ocean. Fifteen years pass, and Galgear manages to break out of his prison, kidnapping the former heroine Valna and being pursued by troops led by Cham as a result. A member of her band, named Rena Brant, requests permission to infiltrate Galgear's stronghold and free Valna on her own; Cham initially disagrees, but a disembodied voice convinces her to allow this, and Rena brings her twin sister Amu with her. They both succeed in reaching Galgear's inner sanctum, but are stopped by the prince and his ring, who is about to obliterate them when they are teleported away by a magic force—that of Asfer, the prince's father, who tells them that only the Valis sword, no longer in this world, can stop him. Both girls journey day and night to reach the heavens of Vecanti and claim the sword, which is bequeathed onto them by Yūko herself, sent with her blessings in stopping the power-hungry prince. They return to Vecanti and use the mystic blade to defeat Galgear.

Valis IV is a side-scrolling action platformer. Picking one of three characters (only one character is available in Super Valis IV), the player fights through a 2D level, jumping from platform to platform and battling enemies, before confronting a boss character at each stage's end. Animated sequences and in-game dialogue help move the story along periodically throughout the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Valis IV", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112888.name: Irukandji
112888.description:
Irukandji is a fun score attack shooter, set in an abstract underwater trench. You fly your ship against the flow of hundreds of amazing procedurally animated sea monsters, blasting your way to the final showdown – a Giant Enemy Crab!

As you play, you unlock a variety of different ships each with its own unique weaponry and play style which offers a different way to play the game. There are also 10 challenging achievements to attempt, and online scores for each ship.

Source: The Developer Website.

112889.name: Suzuka 8 Hours
112889.description:
Suzuka 8 Hours is an arcade game released by Namco in 1992 . It is similar in play to Final Lap, but with motorcycles instead of race cars. A sequel to this game, Suzuka 8 Hours 2, was released by Namco in 1993.

Source: Wikipedia, "Suzuka 8 Hours (arcade game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112890.description:
A beautifully-made variant of n in a row.
Each player gets on the train five animal tiles and try as many of animals place in a row, but in correct environment - the fish in the pond, the bird in the tree, the butterfly on the flower and the hare in the meadow. Star fields are wild areas where each animal may be placed. Who fill all of his tiles first is the winner
112890.name: Eine Reihe Tiere

112891.name: Wissen für Millionen
112891.description:
Objective: be the first travelling round the world and win a million Euros
- moving by turn -
if you found the correct answer for a question move the number you bet for
if you are positioned on a risc area you even have to move back; positioned on a airfield distance is larger, but you are confrontated with more difficult questions like citations, even a bit 'weird' ones
you may choose the level of difficulty, but all players are challenged to find the correct answer - and may move if ...

112892.description:
Promotional game for the Mariahilferstrasse.

Each player has three shopping cards, the player turns around one of his dice in his turn and moves his figure further accordingly. If a figure stops in front of a store, player can take goods chips required for his shopping card. Completed cards should be discarded and new cards are drawn.
If any player plays the last card, the game ends and who has completed most of purchase cards is the winner.
112892.name: Der Einkaufsbummel

112893.name: Wir spielen Regierung !
112893.description:
Title means in English: "We play government!", game was released in 1952.
It was far ahead of its time and with an outstanding equipment.
It was a two-part-game played on both sides of the gameboard:
The first part was a roll-and-move game, but it had many twists to change the later part of the game.
This second part was played on the backside of the board, on a chess-like pattern, divided in 3 color-coded zones.
Not only that the first part decided which chess-figures you had to play with, no, the figures could be equipped with different heads, depending on which party-side you participated.
Winner was the first party to fill 3 squares at the end of the board.
As you would believe, the color-coded zones played a prominent role in moving and capturing, the rules were really interesting, but an awful lot to learn.
Fascinating stuff from the early German post-war era...

112894.description:
From Wargamedownloads.com


Blasters & Bulkheads utilizes the popular Goalsystem game engine to allow players to run Space Opera skirmish battles in a far-flung future. Build a crew of adventurers and ne'er do wells, or command a kill-squad of Galactic Hegemony enforcers. Rules for combat, campaigns, character advancement and more allow for story-driven campaigns, and four pre-built scenarios allow players to jump right into the action. Written for both 15mm and 28mm miniatures, B&B requires only a handful of figures for each side. Complete character creation rules let players build exactly the type of fighters they want, and rules for the mysterious Essence allow for the existence of strange powers. Prime your blaster, draw your energy sword, and battle for the fate of the galaxy's future!
112894.name: Blasters & Bulkheads

112895.name: May's Mysteries: The Secret of Dragonville
112895.description:
EXPERIENCE THE ADVENTURE!

Follow May as she searches for her missing brother, discovering the mysteries and secrets of the puzzling city of Dragonville.

- Intriguing storyline adventure with 80 locations
- Brain-teasing puzzles
- Hidden Object scenes
- Musical minigames
- 270+ total challenges (230 logic puzzles, 25 hidden object games and 13 rhythmic games)
- Travel through 4 intriguing worlds, visit mysterious locations and discover well kept secrets
- Charming hand-drawn graphics
- Meet curious characters along the way who can help you in your journey
- Eight music themes
- Over 25 hours of gameplay

Source: The Publisher Website.

112896.name: Money Mania
112896.description:
Money Mania is a stock-speculating boardgame which is completely depending on the luck of 4 different specially designed dice.
The game can be played as a basic game, where each turn a player rolls the two Company Dice and the two Share Dice to see which of the four Companies he may trade in and how many blocks of shares may be traded (each dice is marked 1, 2 or 3). When shares are bought or sold the price goes up or down one unit on the central gameboard for every block of shares traded. As the share price changes players attempt to buy low and sell high in order to make the most profit.

In the advanced game players can expand their possibilities - take out loans and put options. Various random events, such as market trends are also introduced through the use of event cards.

What adds a little fun is the fact, that you can decide what actions you will take with the different results...
Winner is the first player to amass 1.000.000 credits.

112897.name: Magors Lesezauber
112897.description:
This game is only playable with a tiptoi, a 'smart' pencil with an integrated mp3 player, that reacts when you point it on enabled products like this game.

In this game the players have to solve tasks given by the tiptoi, by pointing the tiptoi at the right pictures, letters or words on the game components.

The games designed to help kids get more familiar with letters. Some sample categories of tasks given by the game:
- Find two pictures, beginning with the same letter
- Decide if a given letter is part of a given word
- Construct a word out of a few given letters
- Find a picture with the right rhyme
- ...

The game has 3 difficulty settings, and is a good way to familiarize kids with their letters, who are still struggling with reading. Once their reading skill has reached a decent level, this game will get boring.

112899.name: Mutations: Book for Killpower Ball
112899.description:
A book of 1000 mutations in french version. 88 pages.
A extension for the game borad Killpower Ball

Here came the second extension Killpower Ball! It comes down to this book consisting of 1000 mutations.

If it is possible to play with mutations in a championship mode with or without money, tournament mode does not the use of this extension.

Mutations, drawn randomly can be positive, neutral or negative.
So take one or two Gladiator is a crucial choice, which will require careful thought as it may to change the future of your team.

It is also possible to use this book to make changes any character your favorite roleboard. However, adaptation will probably be necessary depending on the RPG.

112900.name: Skarabäus
112900.description:
Merrills-meets-memory game where players try to eliminate stones of the opponent by getting three of their own pieces in a row. All pieces, though, are hidden, and all of them have the same figure on their backs: initially the orientation shows which figure is which but after a couple of turns players will have moved, swapped and twisted the pieces often enough to confuse anyone without a very reliable memory.

To add insult to injury, some special pieces (Horus falcons) can be uncovered, with fatal consequences for either player (depending on the situation).

112901.name: Dust to Dust (V20)
112901.description:
From the Back of the Book:

When the ashes cool, all that remains is dust...

Gary, Indiana is a dying city. Its population has halved itself in 40 years, many of its buildings are burned husks, its citizens are disenfranchised and out of work, and even its predators have fled. Of the many Kindred who once hunted this small Midwestern city, only a handful remains. Modius, the Prince of Gary, continues his long rivalry with the Anarch known as Juggler. But their struggles are becoming increasingly irrelevant. If things continue, Gary won't have enough mortals to sustain even a small number of vampires.

The Kindred aren't willing to let the city crumble just yet, though. Juggler and Modius have hit upon a scheme to revitalize the city's importance for Kindred, though each wishes to claim the credit (and the rewards) for this renewal. While they snipe and strike at one another like two starving wolves fighting for the last scrap of meat on the carcass, the Giovanni Maria DiMatto seizes her chance.

Dust to Dust is a story supplement using the Storytelling Adventure System designed for use with Vampire: The Masquerade 20th Anniversary Edition, and it acts as a spiritual successor to the classic story Ashes to Ashes. It includes all the characters and information you need to tell a complete story, as well as notes from the Wrecking Crew, the demo team that ran the story at The Grand Masquerade 2011 in New Orleans.

112902.name: Museum Mayhem
112902.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cut to the chase with this line of encounters, giving you a climactic scene and all the characters and maps you need to run it! Written by Mike Lafferty and Daniel Gallant for ICONS, this first installment is Museum Mayhem. Your players must stop an evil sorceror's attempt to become a Demi-God before things get much, much worse.

This special issue introduces a New Super Power for ICONS: Summon. Let your players or your own characters buy this power to give them the ability to summon forth minions!

This issue also contains two pages of standees for you to print out onto cardstock and use at your gaming table, as well as a map of the museum for the GM. Also included are stats for multiple Minion types as well as a new Supervillain and USHER agents.

112903.name: Darwin's Catalogue: Beastmen of Britain
112903.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Devious and lithe. Powerful and stubborn. Cunning, proud, or even seductive. No race on earth is more varied in appearance or capacities as the Beastmen. Indeed, though Science has clearly found that Beastmen are all of a single race, it seems almost impossible to believe that a stooped, ratlike creature, no matter how sapient, might be cousin to a man with the build and features of a horse or a lion.

Beastmen of Britain builds upon the options for Beastmen characters given in the Victoriana Second Edition Core Rulebook, offering specific Beastmen subtypes each with its own strengths and weaknesses. These optional subtypes work seamlessly with the core rules, and Gamemasters can mix-and-match the “generic” core rules Beastmen and the specific Beastmen offered here with impunity.

Create characters and NPC with the same depth of variety that defines this most fascinating of races!

Darwin’s Catalogue: Beastmen of Britain contains:


Twenty-eight specific Beastmen subtypes, each with a unique blend of attribute adjustments and animal traits



An expanded list of animal traits



Beastmen Hybrids: The half-breed results of Beastmen and other races

112904.name: Combat Mission: Campaigns
112904.description:
Combat Mission Campaigns is an operational wargame where you command forces up to a Division in size during the bloody nightmare of WWII's Eastern Front from 1941-45.

By working in tandem with the award winning Combat Mission: Barbarossa to Berlin game engine, Combat Mission Campaigns allow you to command your troops at the operational level and then play out the resulting battles at the tactical level. CMBB and CMC actually share information back and forth so the disposition and status of troops, experience, fatigue, supply, terrain, weather, time of day and more are seamlessly integrated into both games. Plan your strategies, issue orders and deploy your maneuver units in a dynamic 3D isometric map and when units close to engagement ranges, CMC actually creates the battles (unit positions, status, weather, time of day etc...) to then be played in CMBB. Once the tactical battle is finished, CMBB then sends the results back to CMC and play is continued at the Operational level.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112905.name: Star Wars Live Action
112905.description:
User Summary
Star Wars Live Action is a Star Wars LARP using paintball as the medium in which the game is played. Players have a number of hitpoints and skills based upon the character that they have created. Scenarios may be developed and carried out and characters may upgrade equipment or statistics between games.

112906.name: Combat Mission: Battle for Normandy – Commonwealth Forces
112906.description:
Commonwealth Forces" is the first Module in Battlefront.com's critically acclaimed Combat Mission Battle for Normandy series of WW2 ground warfare tactical simulations. CMBN:CW requires the original game, Combat Mission: Battle for Normandy in order to play, and is compatible with any version available.

Source: The Publisher Website.

112907.name: Starbase Orion
112907.description:
Explore. Expand. Exterminate. Can you defeat your friends and become the ruler of the galaxy?

Starbase Orion is an old-school 4X space strategy game that draws inspiration from titles such as Master of Orion and Galactic Civilizations. Lead your empire from the birth of its space age in Starbase Orion. Colonize new worlds, explore new horizons, and discover other players attempting to do the same. It is a race to the stars where only one empire can declare victory over the galaxy.

Source: The Developer Website.

112908.name: Tank (1991)
112908.description:
User Summary

A modern tank simulation, it was similar to M-1 TANK PLATOON and in fact covered certain aspects in a better fashion, especially larger unit operations. However, terrain slope remained a significant problem and overall, this program was quickly relegated to second place by the consumer.

112909.name: USCF Chess
112909.description:
Catalogue Description

A great new way to play the ultimate game of strategy, whether you're a novice, intermediate or expert. Pit your skill against the computer or an opponent. Select from eight degrees of difficulty and a time limit on moves. Move up in skill as you improve.

112910.name: Move Out
112910.description: Move Out (1971, ADA, $1.50), by Tom Kaeter, simulates man-to-man combat in Western Europe in 1944. It pits all or part of an American infantry platoon (31 men, 31 counters) against a German platoon (32 men, 32 counters). Each side has one of five possible missions as they enter the board from opposite sides. Upside down placement and blank counters are used to add the fog of war. The terrain includes brush, hills, woods, a creek, a pond and two small buildings, one with several rooms. The men have their separate weapons and also a number of individual differences. Some can see better, some run faster, some are sharp-shooters, and others experts at hand to hand combat. Unfortunately, it is a very unfinished game. The rules are hard to figure out and some are almost impossible to carry out. Things are particularly difficult when fighting develops around the buildings. The game is an offshoot of Terry Griner's Patrol, published as a set of rules in Strategy & Tactics Nr. 7, and reading the rules in that source does help to figure out Move Out. Furthermore, the reproduction of the rules and map is quite poor. There are no counters, only pictures of counters and the pictures are hard to decipher. In spite of its faults however, Move Out offers something unusual and worthwhile for anyone who wants to investigate small unit tactics through a game. (Moves Magazine description)

112911.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 8 - 1994)
112911.description:
user summary

Early issue which provided first version of Kryształy Czasu.

articles to be added

112912.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 9 - Apr 1994)
112912.description:
user summary

Early issue which provided first version of Kryształy Czasu.

articles to be added

112916.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 67/68 - Jul/Aug 1999)
112916.description:
Double, summer issue.

articles to be added

112917.name: Demolition Racer
112917.description:
User Summary

A racing game similar to the "Road Rash" series. Your overall standings on the scoreboard are a mixture of race placement and how much damage you inflict on other racers. Your goal is to survive the race, finish as high in the rankings as you can, but also deal out hits with your car to knock other racers around the track, or outright total their car, removing them from the race.

112921.name: Pariah
112921.description:
User Summary

A sci-fi shooter in which you play a corrections officer on a prison transfer. The ship crashes and you're forced to survive.

112923.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 64 - Apr 1999)
rpgissuearticle: Macka szaleństwa czyli ślub Yossy albo opowieść o obłędzie
Zakończenie i prolog albo prolog i zakończenie

112924.name: Zombies!!! Promo Cards
112924.description:
Promo Cards to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the Zombies!!! board game. Adds these cards to the event deck in any game of Zombies!!! (w/ or w/o other expansions) or Zombies!!! 4 and may be drawn as normal.

1.Zombies!!! Yo!
When you play this card, all players must discard all of the bullet tokens they have in play.

2.Master Zombie
When this card is played, all players must discard all Event cards from their hands. Cards in play are not affected.

3.I don't feel so good!
All players discards down to one health.

4.You're not a zombie!
When you are in the same square as a zombie, place it in the zombie pool and place this card in front of you (you take the false zombie as an ally). Now you fight with a +1. Discard this card when you lose a life, instead of losing that life.

Card idea by Jordi Gomez Acosta

5.WTH...10 Years?
Play this card from your hand to move your pawn and another pawn 10 spaces each. Players must fight any zombies encountered using normal combat rules.

6.Battle Royale
All players roll a die. The losers must spend life or bullet tokens to meet or beat the winner's die roll.

112927.name: Sieger-Spiel
112927.description:
Objective: be the first collecting 50 bonus points within 3 categories ==> status, wealth and adventure
- moving by turn -
roll the dice, move your meeple and follow instructions of the area you land on - that's it - sorry
add on bonus points to 3 different areas - don't forget, that minimum amount of points for status is '21'

inspired by novelist Heinz G. Konsalik

112929.name: Steuern?
112929.description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll and Move' game
Roll the die, move and perform required actions listed on the area you land on
Optimize the money you start with by decreasing taxes, acquiring assets, increasing status
Most successful (= bonus points) player wins the game

112930.name: Gwiazdy są w porządku (Issue 3 - Oct 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Co słychać na dworze Azathotha - część 2

112931.name: Elektro Test: Variabel Programmiert
112931.description:
Trivia game with over 500 questions.

This quiz is based on electrical contact - touching the contact surfaces in addition to question and correct answer, the correct answer will light the lamp. Included are 26 tables each with 20 questions, with different topics (many themes from nature, mathematics, history, fairy tales including images).

112932.name: Eskalero Poker
112932.description:
Similar with Yatzee but there are 5 poker dice instead of regulars.
Each player has three rolls in his turn and choose any choose some dice. After the last roll player decides what poker combination hu uses with his dice.

112933.name: Berti Baggerfahrer
112933.description: All excavator drivers try with their equipment to drive around the site, but they have to be careful on the things what is under the earth. A nice run play with a memory factor, certainly most interesting for preschool children, the topic is pretty and the kids can play safely after the declaration alone.

112934.name: Sticky Ninja Academy
112934.description:
Can you become a Sticky Ninja Master? Try in this unusual platform / puzzle game to progress to the ninja heights. Get through 30 levels, defeating enemies to unlock the exit door.

Source: The Developer Website.

112935.name: Eurotest
112935.description:
A quiz and trivia game about Europe.
Topics are geography, history, art and culture, entertainment, sports and science-technology-services. Proper answers gives predetermined number of chips or question cards.
Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner

112936.name: Pursuit of Hat
112936.description:
Ouch - self-mutilating fun for all the family :) Tear off your own limbs to get back your hat in this funny puzzle platformer.

Source: The Developer Website.

112937.name: Brother
112937.description:
Brother is a short, cute and surreal little adventure puzzle game by Luke Thompson that’s all about exploring and figuring things out, playable by anyone.

Source: The Developer Website.

112938.name: ABC + Phantasie
112938.description:
Objective: collect letters (= bonus points) by forming cards to sentences
- acting by turn -
each player may place cards (= words) by turn, creating a sentence in a crossword puzzle 'frame'.
If successful player gets a letter corresponding to the letter on (just) placed card. later on these letters can also be used forming words;
end can be determined (time) or if all cards/letters are used
player collected most letters wins

112939.name: One and One Story
112939.description:
User Summary

One and One Story, by Mattia 'MaTX' Traverso, is not your common platformer. The gameplay changes as the players proceed through the game.

112940.name: Necrorama! Black Thrilling Tales
112940.description:
From the publisher site (in spanish):

¡Bienvenido a Iron City! ¡La ciudad de las oportunidades! ¡La gran urbe de ensueño, donde todo es de color de rosa, los niños juegan felices en los parques y la vida es larga y plena! ¡Mentira, mentira, mentira! Bienvenido al último paraje cósmico, al cagadero universal, a la letrina cuántica, al octavo escalón del Inframundo. Bienvenido a la Ciudad de Hielo, a la Ciudad de Hierro, a la Ciudad de la Sangre y la Larga Noche. Sé bienvenido al Futuro, sé bienvenido al Progreso.

Necrorama es un Juego Narrativo (Story Game) creado por Javier Arce. En él, los jugadores interpretarán a necrólitos -un híbrido industrial entre hombre y demonio- atrapados en un infinito llamado Iron City, tratando de desentrañar los innumerables misterios que se esconden en las sombras de la Ciudad de la Condenación. Necrorama mezcla estilos como el pulp, el steampunk, el noir y la fábula para crear una ambientación única, original y muy mordaz. Tomando la rica inspiración que proporcionan los años 30 y 40, los personajes se enfrentarán a criaturas de la oscuridad, viajarán a la Tierra, flirtearán con la magia y los Arcanos, encontrarán lugares perdidos en el Tiempo y, si tienen mucha suerte, recuperarán sus recuerdos y su alma.

English:

Welcome to Iron City! The city of opportunity! The big city of dreams, where everything is rosy, happy children playing in parks and life is long and full! Lies, lies, lies! Welcome to last place cosmic, the universal shitter, the quantum latrine, on the eighth step of the Underworld. Welcome to the City of Ice, the Iron City, the City of Blood and the Long Night. Be welcome to the future, welcome to Progress.

Necrorama is a narrative game (Story Game) created by Javier Arce. Players take the role of Necrolytes - an industrial hybrid between man and demon - trapped in an infinite-called Iron City, trying to unravel the many mysteries that lurk in the City of Damnation shadows . Necrorama mixes styles such as pulp, steampunk, noir and fable to create a unique ambiance, original and very poignant. Taking the rich inspiration that provide the 30s and 40s, the characters will face creatures of darkness, will travel to Earth, flirting with arcane magic and will find places lost in time and if they are lucky, recover their memories and soul.

112941.name: Bela Kovacs and The Trail of Blood
112941.description:
User Summary

Murder, mystique, melancholy. Film Noire point-and-click investigation in Eastern-Europe.

You play as a retired investigator, Bela Kovacz, hunting down a serial killer of three decades. As you find clues, the mystery around the murders and the suspect unwraps and legends become reality.

112942.name: Párty
112942.description:
In game Párty you take a role of a guest on a party.

Your goal is to become most favorite person on the Party. Players exchange their sympathy between each other, when are drinking and eating, or dancing. First player, who have sympathy of each color, except his own, wins.

112943.description:
The first army list supplement for the Hail Caesar miniatures wargame. The book is 84 pages printed in full color, with army composition guides, gaming stats and notes for 63 different armies from the biblical and classical periods. Beautifully illustrated with full-color photos of ancient miniature armies.

Armies included:

112943.name: Hail Caesar Army Lists: Biblical & Classical

112944.name: Toyland Surprise Game
112944.description:
Objective: collect the most toys
- moving by turn -
player rolls the die and moves according rolled colour
if die shows own colour move twice
if die shows black don't move
if you land on an aera with a case - open the case and take out a toy
if you land on another player's position take a toy from him/her
if you are the first to pass finish line get all remaining toys out of the cases

112945.name: Plan It Green
112945.description:
Back of the Box

Transform Greenville into a fresh, thriving eco-community!

As the newly elected mayor of the rundown city of Greenville, it is your top priority to revitalize the community by bringing about a GREEN renewal.

Overhaul all the districts of your city, use the latest in real-life green technologies and eco-friendly products to get the job done!

112946.name: NHL All-Star Hockey '95
112946.description:
Box Description:

NHL All-Star Hockey shoots... and scores!

All 26 NHL teams, all 650 pro players, an 84 game season, Playoffs, & the Stanley Cup Finals!

-Extra-large players with over 1,000 frames of smooth animation-14 goalie animations alone!

-Leetch and Richter shut down Detroit's high-powered attack. Select manual or automatic goalie control.

-Sampled sound effects with multiple crushing checks!

Fast-paced NHL action!

-All 260 NHL teams including the Mighty Ducks and Florida Panthers. 1994-95 team rosters & NHL schedule.

-All the stars are Here: Messier, Lemieux, Gretzky, Fedorov, Bourque, Lindros, Roenick, Bure, and Gilmour! Players perform according to ratings in 15 categories to ratings in 15 categories like slapshots, speed, stick-handling, etc.

-Marv Albert, voice of the NY Rangers, provides expert color commentary.

-Battery tracks standings and your favourite team's stats all season long!

It's all here - line changes, "speed bursts," cross-checks, one timers, instant replays !

112947.description:
Objective: be the first solving 5 quests and become the "Guardian of the Golden Key"
One of a series of Kosmos games based on the My Secret Unicorn books by Linda Chapman.
In Germany, the series goes by the name, "Sternenschweif" (Star Tail) and the books are also published by Kosmos.
- acting by turn -
7 (out of 48) cards are given to each player
try to collect matching symbols to solve a quest (totally 5)
if you are successful discard the matching ones and fill up your hand
some special cards - like Joker - simplify tasks
due to the fact that last round must be completed a tie is possible
112947.name: Sternenschweif     Der Goldene Schlüssel

112948.name: The Nightmare Before Christmas: The Pumpkin King
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112948.description:
Box Description:

Get ready for a whole new nightmare!

-Live the story of how Jack first met his rival Oogie Boogie!

-Play as Jack Skellington as you battle Oogie and his henchmen for control of Halloween Town!

-Fight with an arsenal of unique weapons like Bat Boomerangs, Jack-O-Lanterns and more!

112949.name: Factory Balls
112949.description:
User Summary

In each level of this puzzle game, you have to paint and/or reshape white balls to match the example given. At your disposal are paint and all kind of equipment. Try to beat all levels, as you progress the levels becomes more challenging.

112950.name: NSYNC: Get To The Show
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
112950.description:
User Summary

The goal of the game is to help JC, Justin, Chris, Joey, and Lance get to their big show on time. You can do this by making snacks, running errands in a stretch limo, and helping the band get warmed up for their big show with a game of hackey-sack.

112951.name: One Piece
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112951.description:
Box Description:

Battle to be king of the pirates!

-Play as Luffy and use your special stretchy skills to defeat the pesky pirates!

-Collect treasure and items to power up and unlock special moves!

-Discover new features like customizable mini-games each time you play!

112952.name: Petz: Cats 2
112952.description:
Box Description:

New Petz

New ways to play!

-Choose a kitten from over 40 different breeds, and make her cuter with clothing and accessories.

-Create a comfortable pet village and guide your lovable bundle of fur through 60 fun adventures.

-Compete against your friends in min-games such as racing.

112953.name: Factory Balls: The Christmas Edition
112953.description:
User Summary

Paint all 16 balls in the Chrsitmas tree to beat this game. Each ball has to be painted in a different patern. The game starts easy but it gets more difficult towards the end.

112954.name: Phil Of The Future
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112954.description:
User Summary

The goal of the game is this. You play as Phil, Keeley, and Curtis, and you have to save your town from the mischievous pets from the future "The Blahs". To do so, you must collect and assemble many futuristic gadgets to solve puzzles, overcome obstacles, and catch the blahs.

112955.name: Ultimate Domain
112955.description:
From the Quick Start Card

A game of colonization and conquest in the Five Worlds of Genesia... You must populate and develo[p your land, colonize adjacent lands, conquer two rival captains or find seven of the jewels of Neort to win.

112956.name: Robofactory
112956.description:
In this game you will:

- Bid in the markets, against the other players for those crucial contracts.
- Develop different technologies to produce more valuable robots.
- Upgrade or add to your production, increasing production capacity.
- Make the tricky decision to invest in new offices to exploit new markets around the world.
- Hire Sales Representatives to enter and hopefully win more auctions.
- Make and deliver the goods within the contract deadlines or pay the missed delivery damages.

You will also probably need to take a few loans, but be careful with the hefty interest!

Will you make the most profit or descend into bankruptcy ?


Robofactory is a zero-luck business simulation economic game about manufacturing robots around the world.

The game is modular and based on a large number of different and unique contract cards with different types of order.

The rules come with many different scenarios for players to decide on the length of the game that ranges from introductory games (60 minutes), quick games (90 minutes), normal games (120 minutes) and long games (180 minutes). Players are also encouraged to set up their own scenarios by combining the many contract cards available (please note that playing with ALL available contract cards will turn the game into epic and last a weekend).

112957.name: Pinball 4000
112957.description:
Back of the Box

Pinball 4000 features:

-4 different tables

-Realistic ball movement

-True tilt action

-The ability to play up to 8 players at once

112958.name: Factory Balls 2
112958.description:
User Summary

The second game in the Factory Balls series, a series of Browser/Flash puzzle games designed by Bonte Games. In each level of this puzzle game, you have to paint and/or reshape balls to match the example given. At your disposal are paint and all kind of equipment. You can even grow grass and flowers on the balls. Try to beat all levels, as you progress the levels becomes more challenging.

112959.name: Shuttle
112959.description:
User Summary

A detailed simulation of shuttle flight and missions.

112960.name: Hexenhaus
112960.description: Hexenhaus is a simple dice-driven game for children. One player is the witch, all others are knights. The witch tries to capture the knights, while the knights try to rescue a princess imprisoned in the witch's cottage and bring her back to the castle without being caught by the witch.

112961.name: Toy Story 3: Lelupeli
112961.description: Roll and move game, where players collect toys when they stop on a step of their own color. When players get to the last straight they give up all of their toys and move as many steps ahead as they had toys. First to reach goal wins.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Expansion or Supplement for an Existing Game Nominee
2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Expansion or Supplement for an Existing Game Winner
112962.description:
(from MMP's website:)

The Siege of Budapest, 1945 - With the issuance of Order Number 11 on 1 December 1944 declaring Budapest to be a "fortress" city, Hitler effectively sealed the fate of 70,000 defending Axis troops and approximately 800,000 civilians.

Festung Budapest, the eighth Historical ASL module, takes players to the western side of the Hungarian capital. Seventeen scenarios and three Campaign Games cover the fighting on the Buda side of the Danube just west of the Castle Hill area during the period from 1 January through 10 February while representing the bitter struggle for the heart of the city.

Festung Budapest also comes with 4 maps and 9 counter sheets. In addition to the entire German SS MMC order of battle (from 8-3-8 to 4-4-7 and including assault engineers), counters are provided for several new types of Hungarian infantry — SMG units, assault engineers, the fascist Arrow Cross Militia, and the anti-communist Vannay Battalion — as well as the Buda Volunteer Regiment, Hungarians fighting for the Russians. Counters are also provided for both Hungarian and Russian air support.

Contents:

4 22" x 28" maps
9 countersheets
1 full-color, 3-hole punched rules Chapter FB (FB1-FB46)
2 Chapter Dividers
3 Campaign Games
17 ASL scenarios

Scenarios: (all take place in Buda, Hungary; Axis = Hungarians & Germans)

FB1 Uncles and Pups - 1 January 1945; Axis vs Russian, 4 ½ turns
FB2 The Devil’s Free To Have A Try - 19 January 1945; Axis vs Russian, 7 turns
FB3 Furor Hungaricus - 20 January 1945; Axis vs Russian, 6 ½ turns
FB4 HKL 259 - 27 January 1945; Axis vs Russian, 6 ½ turns
FB5 Siesta Time - 29 January 1945; Hungarian vs Russian, 6 ½ turns
FB6 Came Tumbling After - 29 January 1945; Axis vs Russian, 6 ½ turns
FB7 The Terror of the Castle - 31 January 1945; Hungarian vs Russian, 9 turns
FB8 For Want Of Either Crust Or Crumb - 1 February 1945; Axis vs Russian, 6 turns
FB9 The Shooting Gallery - 2 February 1945; Axis vs Russian, 7 turns
FB10 The Black Company - 3 February 1945; Axis vs Russian, 5 ½ turns
FB11 Boy Soldier - 4 February 1945; Hungarian vs Russian, 6 ½ turns
FB12 The Black Ravens Are Flying - 5 February 1945, Axis vs Russian, 5 turns
FB13 Don’t Economize - 7 February 1945; Axis vs Russian, 7 turns
FB14 At The Narrow Passage - 7 February 1945; Hungarian vs German vs Russian; 5 turns
FB15 The Taking of Object 59 - 7 February 1945; Axis vs Russian, 6 ½ turns
FB16 Crossing The Bloody Meadow - 8 February 1945; Axis vs Russian, 6 turns
FB17 Stalingrad Redux - 10 February 1945; German vs Russian, 5 ½ turns
112962.name: Festung Budapest

112963.name: Karuta
112963.description:
Traditional Japanese game where a card is revealed from the top of draw pile and players try to find its pair from the cards laid on the table.
Uta-garuta has first three lines of a tanka poem written on the cards in the draw pile and the last two lines on the cards laid on the table, these two cards form a pair. Another version, iroha/garuta, which is mostly played by children for education, has kana written on the other card and a poem or proverb starting with the same kana written on the other card.

112964.name: Super Mario 3D Land
videogamehonor: 2011 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2011 Spike Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Winner
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2012 D.I.C.E. Handheld Game of the Year Winner
2012 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
112964.description:
From the back of the box

Mario leaps into a new dimension!
Mario returns to his roots in an all-new adventure in 3D!

112965.name: Factory Balls 3
112965.description:
User Summary

Third edition in the Factory Balls series, a series of Browser/Flash puzzle games, designed by Bonte Games. In each level of this puzzle game, you have to paint and/or reshape balls to match the example given. At your disposal are paint and all kinds of other equipment. You can even grow grass and flowers on the balls. Try to beat all 30 levels. Starts easy but the higher levels can be a real challenge.

112966.name: November 2011: For Your Health
112966.description:
From Introduction:

For Your Health

The discussion of Zombie survival is a forum in which we explore our species' ability to withstand great dilemmas and challenges. While the acquisition of food, water, and safe shelter are the fi rst needs of survival, long term needs start to become apparent as life drags on.

There are obvious detriments to neglecting specific vitamins, (such as scurvy) but a little known side effect of relying too heavily upon one form of nutrition is what is known as 'Rabbit Starvation', which is where food is still being consumed, but the nutrition is so poor that the body will still be starved.

112967.name: Pokerom Pikachu
112967.description:
User Summary

Filled with various Pokemon-based mini-games, including puzzles, find a Pokemon, and triva. There are 20 different editions of this game, with different Pokemon in each.

112968.description:
This is a small expansion for the game 1001 Karawane, which adds 4 cards and 4 tiles to the base game.
The rules come with the expansion.
112968.name: 1001 Karawane: Sonderchips

112969.name: Factory Balls 4
112969.description:
User Summary

Fourth game in the Factory Balls series, a series of Browser/Flash puzzle games designed by Bonte Games. In each level of this puzzle game, you have to paint and/or reshape balls to match the example given. At your disposal are paint and all kind of equipment. Try to beat all 30 levels. Start easy but the higher levels can be a real challenge.

112970.name: Bit.Trip Core
112970.description:
BIT.TRIP CORE is the second installment in CommanderVideo's soul quest with:


Single Player and 2 Player Local Co-op!
Beautiful Boss Battles!
Classic NES-Style Controls!
A Thumpin' Chiptune-Inspired Soundtrack!
Special Chiptune Guest Star Bubblyfish!
Mind-Melting Challenges!
Revealing Cutscenes!


Source: The Publisher Website.

112971.name: Bit.Trip Void
112971.description:
BIT.TRIP VOID continues CommanderVideo's epic journey with:


Up to 4 Player Local Co-op!
Mid-Level Checkpoints!
Epic Boss Battles!
Nunchuk & Classic Controller Support!
A Rockin' Chiptune-Inspired Soundtrack!
Special Chiptune Guest Star Nullsleep!
Synesthetic Music/Art/Gameplay Interaction!
Hyper-realistic Retro Cutscenes!


Source: The Publisher Website.

112972.name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie (Game Boy)
112972.description:
User Summary

Based off of the movie of the same name. There are six levels in the game, and the user can decide which order they play them aside from the final level. You can choose to play as any of the six Rangers, and your goal is to defeat the morphilogical being known as Ivan Ooze and save the Earth.

112973.name: Bit.Trip Fate
112973.description:
FATE is the penultimate chapter in the six-part BIT.TRIP series and will leave you wondering what’s next.


The Nunchuk controls CommanderVideo and the Wii Remote’s pointer fires anywhere on screen!
Collect power-ups to call on CommanderVideo’s friends for powerful shot upgrades!
A chiptune-inspired dubstep soundtrack helps bring the action to a whole new level!
Video game worlds collide with appearances from Super Meat Boy and Mr. Robotube!
Chipmusic artist Minusbaby helps set the tone with a special guest appearance!


Source: The Publisher Website.

112974.name: Bit.Trip Flux
112974.description:
The BIT.TRIP series comes full-circle with BIT.TRIP FLUX: CommanderVideo's final adventure. Grab your Wii Remote and get ready for classic paddle-based gameplay as CommanderVideo returns to the source. Whether playing in single-player or in two player co-op, you'll be faced with new challenges that will make even the most experienced BIT.TRIPPERS weep. Enjoy new challenges presented within the familiar paddle-based gameplay which started the phenomenon called BIT.TRIP.


New Power-Ups including the Fullscreen Paddle!
New Beat Types including Avoid Blobs!
Mid-Level Checkpoints!
Classic BIT.TRIP BEAT Gameplay now with all the Modes including the new Meta Mode!
Bit Shifter Returns as the Chiptune Gueststar!


Source: The Publisher Website.

112975.name: Power Rangers: Dino Thunder (Game Boy Advance)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112975.description:
Box Description:

Go Dino Thunder Rangers!

The mad scientist Mesogog has plans to send the world back into the age of dinosaurs. Through the power of the DinoGems, three students are transformed into the Dino Thunder Power Rangers. Help the Power Rangers use their powers and the DinoZords to stop Mesogog and his Tyrannodrones.

-Over 20 levels including Megazord battles

-Play as the Red, Blue, and Yellow Dino Thunder Power Rangers each with unique abilities and attacks

-Awesome Megazord battles with interchangeable arms!

112976.name: Bit.Trip Saga
112976.description:
From back of box

The must-have Retro-Arcade Rhythm Music Series!


6 complete games
80 levels of gameplay
5 acclaimed chiptune artists
25+ story cutscenes
Countless hours of fun

112977.name: The Proud Family
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112977.description:
User Summary

In The Proud Family, Penny Proud finds herself determined to get her parents a T.H.A.N.G., the Total Home Automated Necessity Gizmo for their upcoming anniversary. Players must help Penny as she takes on a wide array of jobs, from being a waitress at Chez Wizard to creating new snack mixes at the Factory and mastering the art of making pizza. As Penny makes her way through the neighborhood, players encounter favorite characters like Suga Mama and Penny's friends, who give her advice and direction, as she earns the money to buy the T.H.A.N.G. through a series of replayable mini-games and missions.

112978.name: Tetris Axis
112978.description:
From back of box

Nintendo 3DS takes Tetris to a whole new Dimension!

Traditional and brand-new modes!

New ways to manipulate Tetriminos!

Battle up to seven friends using one Game Card or go online to take on the rest of the world!

112979.name: Quatra Command
112979.description:
Box Description:

The enemy's ships have been sighted... and suddenly you're in command!

You were ordered to the Quatra Sector to investigate and confirm that enemy battle ships have been sighted. But as you came out of hyperspace, your communications system was damaged and now you can't contact your outpost. The command decisions are yours to make. What now?

You must take on the enemies singlehandedly and obtain their weapons. Not only will this help you score points, but it will help your mission. Look out! The enemy is shooting at you! It's important to maneuver carefully and avoid being hit. People are depending on you. Feeling courageous? Move up another level to improve your score. But don't forget your true mission - to protect the Quatra Sector with all your skill and daring!

Try the fast-paced, action-packed game that puts you in command -- Quatra Command.

112980.name: R.B.I. Baseball 2
112980.description:
Box Description:

If it gets any more realistic, you'll need a glove to play!

RBI Baseball first set the standard as the only baseball game for play on the NES to use real players and their stats.

RBI Baseball 2 raises the standard to a new level:

-You get all 26 Pro teams, each with a roster of 24 real players.

-Every player comes with his actual 1989 stats.

-There's Instant Replay, as well as new and improved animation, graphics, music and sound effects to make the game come alive!

-As the manage, you get the designated-hitter rule, switch-hitting, and your own lineup of starters and subs.

-It's so great, it's approved by the Major League Baseball Players Association!

112981.name: Sugar, Sugar
112981.description:
User Summary

Sugar, sugar is a browser/Flash game, designed by Bonte Games and released in march 2011.

Guide sugar particles falling down from the sky to your cup, using your mouse to create a path. Split the sugar particles, colour them or even change gravity to reach your goals in this action puzzle game.

112982.name: Rally Fusion: Race Of Champions
112982.description:
Box Description:

Screaming breaks. Groaning engines. Grinding gears.

Ah, the sounds of the Great Outdoors.

Skid, drift, swerve, slide and race across amazing, interactive tracks in 9 huge environments, from rain forests and arctic glaciers to desert dunes and tropical islands. Put your driving skills to the ultimate test as you compete for the Race Of Champions crown against over 30 world-class drivers in racing's hottest rally cars. If you're insane enough to take the wheel, you may be insane enough to take rally racing's most coveted prize.

-Tear up the terrain in a multitude of modes, including Follow The Leader, Elimination, Relay and Rallycross.

-Jockey for position-and even collide-with ruthless competitors in chaotic packs of cars.

-Tackle hazardous weather and teal-time damage that accurately affect performance.

112983.name: Rayman: Raving Rabbids (GBA)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112983.description:
Box Description:

Rayman vs bunnies gone bad

Rayman's peaceful world has been invaded by an army of... little white bunnies!

-Collect the costumes to go face pop, rock or hip hop and get new powers to defeat the bunnies!

112984.name: Real Pool
112984.description:
Box Description:

-Test your skills in more than 12 different pool games including 8-Ball, 9-Ball, Rotation, and additional games such as Carom and Bowliards.

-Real-world physics-every shot behaves like it's on a real pool table.

-Play the unique Puzzle Mode with 25 devious tables including triangles, stars and more.

-Go one-on-one in the exciting Tournament Mode; defeat 8 strong AI opponents to become the ultimate pool shark!

-1 or 2 player competitive action

112985.name: AI War: Children of Neinzul
112985.description:
Today I am born, today I die.

The Neinzul are an insectoid race of perpetual "younglings" that live for an extremely short span before dying and being superseded by fully-aware and vicious replacements. Their Enclaves form mini-collectives with their own personalities, goals, and desires. In this second expansion to AI War, players face off against the Neinzul minor factions, against new AI types in general, and enlist the help of the friendlier members of this new alien presence.

Enclave Starships bring a long-awaited feature: mobile space docks. New map types and new capturables add more excitement. Optionally, Hybrid Hives bring a new type of AI logic to the game: these free agents are like a coordinated pack of velociraptors hunting you against the backdrop of the regular AI forces. For advanced players, the Hybrid Hives provide more cut-throat opposition than ever.

Key Features:


36 new ships, including:
5 new ship classes with a variety of abilities.
Enclave Starships and Regeneration Chambers for direct unlock.
6 new AI special weapons.
6 new AI Types.
3 Neinzul alien minor factions (NPCs).
Devastating new Hybrid Hives AI plot.
3 new in-game music tracks.
Two new map styles: X and Concentric Circles.


Source: The Publisher Website.

112986.name: AI War: Light of the Spire
112986.description:
The Spire are coming...

Ravaged by their recent encounters with the same AIs that pushed humanity to the brink of extinction, the Spire are an alien race that have also been all but destroyed. However, while the AIs were successful in their surprise attack against the Spire, the Spire are far more powerful than even the AIs seem to have realized. The Zenith were broken-down and ancient when humanity encountered them, but the Spire were at the height of their deadly power until quite recently.

Now the splintered remains of their race are regrouping, and entering the galaxy with a vengeance. Their attitude toward humanity, who after all spawned the AIs that harmed the Spire so, is unclear. Proceed with caution.

Key Features


180 new ships, including massive "spirecraft" (larger than starships, smaller than golems).
Nine new bonus ship classes featuring oversized starship-like spire ships.
New Defender campaign type that allows for a way to play shorter sessions.
New AI weapons: Beachheads AI Plot, 4 core guard posts, and 10 guardians.
Exciting Fallen Spire story-based campaign-within-a-campaign. Alternate way to win!
New in-game music tracks.


Source: The Publisher Website.

112987.name: Blue Dragon Plus
112987.description:
One year after the events of the original game, the world continues to embrace and explore the cube worlds that resulted from the opening of the planet's core. One day King Jibral and Zola encounter a mysterious evil three-headed dragon shadow called Balaur emerging from one of the cubes. Zola has a bad feeling about it and after informing Shu and the party, they find themselves on another adventure to discover this new threat.

Blue Dragon Plus is a real time strategy game. Its gameplay style is similar to that of Final Fantasy XII: Revenant Wings, also for the DS. It can be played entirely with the Nintendo DS stylus. Like in Revenant Wings, battles initiate once the party comes in contact with the enemy, and the characters can attack automatically. Characters can also engage in Shadow Battles when an enemy with a shadow is encountered. Magic can be used when characters use their skills by summoning their shadows.

Source: Wikipedia, "Blue Dragon Plus", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

112988.name: Resident Evil: Dead Aim
112988.description:
Box Description:

A deadly game of search and pursuit

Join anti-Umbrella search and pursuit team agent, Bruce MacGavin, as he encounters a new layer of Umbrella's insidious activities. In this all-new Resident Evil first-person action-shooter, you must search, sneak and use battle moves to regain control of a sea-jacked cruise ship lost in the Atlantic. And should you find yourself trapped amongst hordes of zombies and mutant beasts, your aim better be dead on!

-First person, seamless navigation and combat

-Sharp graphics and intuitive gameplay

-Weapon upgrades as you progress through the game

-An all new Resident Evil story-line

-Guncon 2 Light Gun Controller compatible (also supports DualShock 2 Controller.)

-An intense blend of action and puzzle solving

112989.name: Delve Deeper: Treasures and Tunnels
112989.description:
Extend Delve Deeper with 10 new levels and 25 brand new relics; that’s 50% more Delve Deeper maps and 30% more treasure. Each level is custom-tailored to be tackled by different team combinations, and each relic custom-designed to add new excitement to every map!

Source: The Publisher Website.

112990.name: Risk/Battleship/Clue
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112990.description:
Box Description:

Risk

In this classic Global Domination game of military strategy, you are battling to conquer the world. To win, you must launch daring attacks, defend yourself on all fronts, and sweep across vast continents with boldness and cunning. But remember, the dangers, as well as the rewards, are high. Just when the world is within your grasp, your opponent might strike and take it all away!

Battleship

First there was paper and pencil, then came the board game versions. Now, all the fun of Battleship has been brought to the Game Boy Advance. Using your skill and logic, can you be the first to sink all 5 of your opponents ships before they can sink yours. Have nobody to play against. No problem. Take on the Game Boy Advance in a one-player game.

Clue

Welcome to Tudor Mansion. Your host, Mr. John Boddy, has met an untimely end - hes the victim of foul play. To win this game, you must determine the answer to these three questions: Who did it, where and with what weapon.

112991.description:
Munchkin Conan is a 168-card core set in the Munchkin family of games, with 101 Doors and 67 Treasures. Unlike other core sets, it lacks unique card backs, instead using the standard card back from Munchkin. The included Munchkin-head d6 is yellow with dark red print.

In Munchkin Conan, Robert E. Howard's epic hero gets the full Munchkin treatment. Play a Cimmerian Warrior or a Stygian Wizard! Wield the Sword of the Phoenix and poison your foes with Black Lotus! Slay Thoth-Amon's minions, Pict raiders, and abominable monsters, and hear the lamentations of their women! On many of the cards, the publisher provides context by including relevant quotes from Howard's work.

Munchkin Conan has a new type of card – birthright – and the mechanisms are similar to that of classes and races in that you can have only one in play at a time; you may discard a birthright at any time but may play one only on your turn or when you first get it. The Munchkin Conan core set comes with two birthrights: "Noble", which allows you to have an extra Comrade (see below), and "Barbarian", which allows you to ignore all "Usable By" and "Not Usable By" restrictions on items. There is no birthright analogue to "Super Munchkin" or "Half-Breed".

Speaking of races and classes, the races in Munchkin Conan are "Kushite", "Zamoran", "Cimmerian", and "Stygian"; when playing a blender game, they are all considered to be human unless the other sets have non-human races. The classes are "Cleric", "Thief", "Warrior", and "Wizard", and are identical to the fantasy Munchkin classes with the same names.

The Munchkin Conan hireling is called a Comrade. Comrades fall in the same class as the Hirelings, Minions, Mooks, Sidekicks, etc. that come with other flavors of Munchkin. Each Comrade is associated with a class or birthright, and gives you some of the advantages of that class/birthright. Comrades can carry an item for you, even some that you can't legally use yourself, and their gender matters. They also have the standard Hireling ability to sacrifice themselves to give you an automatic escape when running away.

Part of the Munchkin series.
112991.name: Munchkin Conan

112992.name: The Santa Clause 3: The Escape Clause
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112992.description:
Box Description:

Twas the fight before Christmas!

Join Santa and his elves to stop Jack Frost from wreaking holiday havoc!

-Battle the icy villain & his frozen followers

-Go on wild sleigh rides to deliver presents

-Race to build toys in time for the holidays

112993.name: Scooby-Doo: Mystery Mayhem (GBA)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
112993.description:
Box Description:

"Relp Rhaggy!"

Mystery Inc. is back to solve a caper of supernatural proportions. Lead Scooby and Shaggy through five huge episodes filled with scary monsters and spooky ghosts. Will you help our heroes for a Scooby Snack?

-Escape from creepy monsters.

-Explore huge environments including a mine and movie set.

-Play as either Scooby or Shaggy.

-Zip through each episode's wild ride.

112994.name: The Scorpion King: Rise Of The Akkadian
112994.description:
Box Description:

Experience the adventure that started it all.

In an original story inspired by the blockbuster film, The Scorpion King, the Akkadians were a tribe of warriors unparalleled in the deadly art of assassination. Their skill is put to the ultimate test when a dark lord named Magus is determined to harness the powers of the Underworld.

Play as The Scorpion King using all of your wits, training, and weapons to defeat Magus before he unleashes an army of bloodthirsty creatures on mankind.

-Smash your way through fantastic environments.

-Non-stop action with fierce hand-to-hand & weapon-based combo attacks.

-Battle the Underworld's toughest supernatural creatures.

112995.description:
The Battle of Nations - 14-19 October, 1813

Napoleonic 20 #16 (Germany 20 #7)

What began at the Battle of Dresden and continued to unfold on battlefieds across the German States including Kulm, Dennewitz, Grossbeeren, Gorlitz, and the Katzbach River, have all led up to this. Four Allied nations, and their four armies are converging on Napoleon’s Grande Armée as it falls back to its supply base at Leipzig. More than a half-million soldiers will stand and face eather other over these fateful days, which are now yours to command in this epic installment of VPG's venerable Napoleonic 20 series. The Battle of Nations awaits!

Featuring a strategic scale with corps-sized units and mult-hour game turns, play moves smartly across this, the largest single game map in this series. Helping to tell the narrative of this great battle are new types of Event cards and the inclusion of Strategy cards allowing players to choose their pre-battle disposition and set their overall plan. This tense-and-ever-growing meeting engagement will require skill and strategic sense to master.

Innovations to this game series include the addition of Leader units, whose command span shows the limits of leadership over such a sprawling battlefield. Also, to show the prolonged effects of keeping troops committed to battle, a simple Fatigue system has been added to keep players thinking about reasting their weary forces over the multiple days of the fighting.

Game Data:

Complexity: 5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 4 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit is 1 corps, each hex is about 1000 meters, and each turn is roughly 3.5 day hours (or 10 night hours).

Game Components:

• One 8-page, color instructions booklet, with Standard and Optional rules included
