Only the fatest racer will become the "World Champion R.C. Racer"

videogame: Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty
112613.name: Metal Gear Solid HD Collection
videogamecompilation: Metal Gear Solid: The Legacy Collection
Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty
112613.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Metal Gear 2 Substance, Metal Gear 3 Subsistence, and Metal Gear Peace Walker with all games updated for high definition.

112614.name: The Trouble with Rose
112614.description:
The Trouble with Rose is a co-operative story telling game with role playing and hand management. Players can collaboratively build a world, use an existing setting, or select one from a number of play sets.

Components: A standard deck of playing cards and a set of double six dominoes are required for play. Note taking materials for player created worlds and characters is suggested if a play set is not used.

Game Play: Each player is dealt a hidden agenda and either creates a character on the fly or uses one from the selected play set. Players then pull four to five dominoes (depending on the number playing.) The game begins with playing one of the dominoes from your hand and creating a scene based on the pips and their matching values for that character. After the scene, the remaining people at the table can embellish the scene and vote to determine if the player earned the points on the domino and can add it to their score. Play continues around the table until all the dominoes in hand are used. At that time, the hidden agendas are revealed and any bonus points are awarded. High score wins and gets to describe the fate of the players and any NPCs that were created.

Theme: TTwR started out as a Game Chef 2011 entry and was expanded and polished after the contest. The theme for GC'11 was Shakespeare and TTwR is designed to create character driven stories that tend to take tragic and comedic turns. Game play is wide open, but the rules provide the structure for story telling among strangers and play testing/con games have shown that the system delivers on the fun.

112615.name: 1,2 oder 3 das Spiel
112615.description:
Objective: collect as many winning chips as possible

close to the rules of the popular TV-show you try to mislead your opponents placing your meeple as short as possible before the jingle is sounding onto 'true area'
the magic pen shows the correct answer (out of 3) and you should get a chip if you were right
content:
- board
- magic pen
- 198 x 2 question & answer cards
- 90 chips
- 9 meeples
- rules
battery is needed (for magic pen working)
depending on edition no. of cards may vary

112616.name: Fantasy Zone: The Maze
videogameversion: North American Sega Master System edition
112616.description:
User Summary

Opa Opa, from the Zillion anime, is back, in a new game, that is not like others from the series.
You will navigate with opa opa in a pac man like maze, collection coins and avoiding Menons. You can use coins to improve the defense, speedy or buy guns to help in your quest.

112617.name: Biribi
112617.description:
The game board depicts a rug with three connected, diamond-shaped areas of 3 x 3 fields each. The goal is to get as many of one's own playing pieces to the far end of the board.
Each player has five coins. In each turn, a player can move a coin one field forward. When a coin can reach one of the opponent's coins, it climbs on top of that. This is called a Biri, it can move two fields, but not eliminate further coins. It can be caught by a single coin of the opponent. The resulting "Biribi" can move three fields and can't be eliminated.
When a Biri or Biribi reaches the far end of the board, opponent's coins are discarded, one's own coins are scored. Whoever managed to get most coins across is the winner.

112618.name: Gangbusters!
112618.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Somebody is supplying the local street gangs of the City with high-tech super-science weaponry. The police are overwhelmed!

Can the heroes discover the source of the weapons and stop the chaos that threatens to engulf the entire City? They'll have to be more than just heroes - they'll have to be... GANGBUSTERS!

GANGBUSTERS! is a complete adventure, ready for the heroes of your ICONS campaign - or playable with the provided pre-generated hero team: The Storm Agency!

112619.name: Whiteout!
112619.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A freak blizzard dumps several feet of snow on the heroes' city. While assisting local authorities, they discover that cities all across the country, and the world, are also being buried by unnatural snowstorms.

Can the heroes discover the source of the blizzards and stop them? Or will the world witness the coming of a new Ice Age in.... "WHITEOUT!"

112621.name: TurboPad
112621.description:
User Summary:

The standard controller for the TurboGrafx-16. It contains a dish style directional pad, buttons I and II , a select button and a run button. It also contains built in turbo button functionality, controlled by two toggles one each for the I and II buttons.

112622.name: Revolution Under Siege
videogamehonor: 2010 Charles S. Roberts Best 20th Century Era - Modern Computer Wargame Nominee
2010 Charles S. Roberts Best Computer Game Graphics Nominee
112622.description:
User Summary

A detailed simulation of the Russian Civil War (1917-1923).

112623.name: Operation Bookbinder
112623.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It is late June in 1942, a few weeks after the US Navy decisively defeated the Imperial Japanese Navy in a battle near the Midway Atoll. The PCs are Allied super soldiers who are being transferred to the USS Enterprise in anticipation of a Japanese super soldier attack.

Operation: Bookbinder is a short adventure for WWII supers. It can be used alone or in combination with Vigilance Press' line of WWII character folios, especially Pearl Harbor December and Vigilance Force.

112624.name: Der Panzer-Ritter
112624.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"The boys in military intelligence have received some disturbing reports about another Nazi super-weapon. This one has a stranger parentage than usual. It’s a collaboration between the Nazi advanced robotics engineers and the cultists of the Thule Society."

"The German defectors we’ve talked to tell us this collaboration is called the “Panzer-Ritter”. It’s a massive Nazi battle robot, like you may have encountered before. However, instead of conventional power source, it’s allegedly fueled by black magic and it reportedly has both conventional and occult weaponry. Tomorrow night there will be a ceremony in which several Thule Society cultists will conduct a ritual and their soul, life energy (or whatever you want to call it) will power up this “Panzer-Ritter”. The defectors tell us that if you can stop the ritual from completing, you can keep this from happening. Which, it goes without saying, is much preferable to having to fight this monster once it powers up."

"Whether or not you believe in this mumbo-jumbo is immaterial. The brass is worried enough by whatever this actually is that they want you to recon the area. So, your team is going to the village of Donnersburg immediately to investigate. Your orders are to interrupt the ritual and sabotage this war-machine they can activate it. Failing that, your orders are to destroy the Panzer-Ritter before it can be used against Allied forces and attempt to bring back prisoners that we can interrogate."

112625.name: Werewolves of the Gestapo
112625.description:
Publisher's blurb:

We just received word that Jean Fontaine, a high-ranking member of the French Resistance was kidnapped by some new kind of superhuman Gestapo field agents. Our sources inform us that he has been spirited away to a mansion in a wooded area near Stausberg and is under heavy meta-human guard while the Gestapo's best interrogators work him over.

If he breaks, he could compromise the entire French Resistance. Our double-agents have provided us with the location of the mansion where he is being tortured by Gestapo interrogators. Your job is to rescue him immediately.

112626.name: The Undead Stormtroopers of Grunwald
112626.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As the Allies close in from the East and West, Nazi mad scientists and cultists at Castle Grunerwald have unlocked dark secrets and are raising undead legions to save the Reich from its enemies.

Can your heroes storm Castle Grunerwald, thwart the Nazis and bring their unholy experiments to an end?

The Undead Stormtroopers of Grünerwald! is a Battle Scene; a fleshed out adventure hook. It provides enemies, an expanded plot hook and advice on running the scenario. It's designed for short, frantic, fun play sessions.

112627.name: Gorilla Warfare
112627.description:
Publisher's blurb:

High in the Himalayas, Allied supply planes are falling prey to a violent creation of Nazi Mad Science run amok.The PCs are called in to investigate.

But are the heroes ready for the unbridled brutality of Gorilla Warfare?

Battlescenes: Gorilla Warfare is a short scenario for ICONS characters in a WWII setting. It can be used alone or in combination with Vigilance Press' line of WWII character folios.

112628.name: Zombies Ate My Brains
112628.description:
In Zombies ate my Brains (ZAMB) you are a newly created Zombie just trying to get some fresh human brains to keep you in peek undead form. Those pesky living ones however seem to want you dead, for real this time. Can you eat their brains before they destroy your rotting body? Find out if you have the right stuff come the Zombie Apocalypse.

ZAMB is a solo card game in which you have 2 decks, one is your play deck and the other is the Humans. You also have a set of cards to represent you the Zombie- which as you take damage changes your ability to draw cards and also effects your defence and offensive capabilities. Gameplay involves managing whatever the humans throw at you and using your hand/deck you try to defeat the game as more and more threats come into play. Picking the wrong option is deadly to the undead.

The Zombies over run the world and win if there are no more human cards left to play and yet your undead minion is still in (at least) one piece.

The game is a fast playing light card game which can also be played as a 2 player format with one player taking control of the Humans. In solo play the game rarely goes over 10 minutes play time.

112629.name: Death from Below
112629.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Axis forces have a new weapon: a subterranean troop carrier. Carrying specially trained stormtroopers, this vehicle comes up behind enemy formations and wreaks havoc on Allied war plans.

Your superiors have good intelligence on when and where the next subterranean insertion will occur. Armed with this knowledge, they have asked you to be waiting for the vehicle to capture or destroy it.

112630.name: The Stormtroopers of the Deep
112630.description:
Publisher's blurb:

STORMTROOPERS OF THE DEEP! is a basic convoy defense scenario. The PCs are assigned to guard a top secret shipment of war supplies after a rash of startlingly successful attacks in the Atlantic has the brass convinced that the Nazis have a new naval superweapon.

This scenario can be used with Allied characters associated with the war effort in the UK, US or USSR. The close alliance between these three powers makes it reasonably plausible that super-soldiers from any of those nations could be guarding the convoy.

At the GM's discretion, the convoy is destined for either Great Britain or the Soviet Union. If the convoy is going to the UK, it will be leaving from St. John's, Newfoundland bound for Liverpool. If the convoy is headed for the USSR, the PCs will join it as it leaves from Hvalfjörður, Iceland and is bound for Arkhangelsk in the northern Soviet Union.

112631.name: Moth Eating Catz Destroyed my Broadband
boardgameversion: Game Crafter Deluxe Version first edition
112631.description:
In Moth Eating Catz Destroyed My Broadband you are desperately trying to gain as much buzz as possible so people notice your spamchat and gain the win for the net, if only for your 15 seconds of fame.

Using advanced router technology you generate buzz but have to use moths and catz to deploy your assets to take down your fellow chatters. In this fast and fun game you will lolz, cry and win.

Remember its not the playing but the crushing your enemies that counts

This game is a random, light and chaotic game which contains- Moths, lolz Cats and random events as well as heavy dose of bad humour. The point of the game is to protect your router whilst generating buzz which in turn grants you Victory points. However you are limited in the actions you can take and will have to fight off the other players.

The game was inspired by random comments on the BGG chat feed for Essen 2011. It therefore is meant to evoke the random, bizarre and downright silly things that occur in chat feeds to live events when to many geeks gather together.

112632.name: The People's Revolution (ICONS Edition)
112632.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Soviet super-team, the People's Revolution, was formed by the Kremlin in 1941 in response to demands from the Red Army for an organized force to counter the Nazi's super soldier forces. Although the British and American super soldiers receive the most attention and glory (at least in Western histories), the WW2 era People's Revolution team fought arguably the hardest, bloodiest and most prolonged struggle of any metahuman force in recorded history.

They were Red Hammer, Night Witch, Ice Fang, Trans-Siberian Express, Red Legionnaire, Battle Czar, Sovi-Ape, Revolutionary Fire and Kasatka.

This is a character folio for ICONS detailing the villains listed above.

112633.name: Homefront Heroes (ICONS Edition)
112633.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Homefront Heroes is the next in Vigilance Press' popular line of USHER Universe supplements set in WWII!

In the Golden Age of comics, most comics were set on the "homefront" and centered on heroes who, for a variety of reasons, were left behind from the war effort. Homefront Heroes shows what was happening on this crucial front during the war, fighting 5th column subversives and saboteurs.

Homefront Heroes introduces several new heroes to the USHER Universe of the WWII era: Bronze Bomber, Brother Survivor, Captain Awesome, Captain Whizbang, Crimson Cyclone, Freedom Song, Invalid, Iron Chief, Lamplighter, Peacemaker, Volunteer and White Lady.

Homefront Heroes also covers life on the homefront during WWII, and a discussion of how heroes were depicted during the Golden Age, contrasted with how later eras of comics treated the war.

All art in Homefront Heroes is done by Jon Gibbons, an amazingly talented artist from the UK who has done work for Mongoose Publishing, Adamant Entertainment and Ronin Arts. His cinematic art style has also contributed heavily to the look and feel of Vigilance Press' entire USHER Universe line.

Homefront Heroes is written by gaming legend Steve Perrin. Steve has written and contributed to many legendary games over his storied career including: Runequest, Call of Cthulhu, Stormbringer and Thieves' World.

His supers-specific writing includes games, such as Superworld, Worlds of Wonder, the official Elfquest RPG and the Champions module V.O.I.C.E. of Doom. He has also written comics for Heroic Publishing including Flare, League of Champions and Liberty Comics.

112634.name: Pangya: Fantasy Golf
112634.description:
User Summary:

Pangya: Fantasy Golf is an arcade style golf game based on an MMO from South Korea. The player can choose any of 18 diverse characters and customize their appearance and golfing equipment. There are various game modes such as story, tournament, single round and network multiplayer that take place across 9 different golf courses.

112635.name: Heroes and Villains of the Cold War
112635.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It contains a detailed timeline of the Cold War in a super-powered comic book universe and detailed write-ups and stats for one of the most iconic villains in this setting: General Venom. Formerly the leading patriotic hero in the US, General Venom has gone renegade and sworn to topple the corrupt US government...

112636.name: Copperhead Guard
112636.description:
Publisher's blurb:

General Venom's elite bodyguard force and inner circle, the operatives in this unit are all highly trained, multi-talented mercenaries and assassins. They also are all beautiful women. With their combat skills honed by a training program said to rival Navy SEAL training in sheer toughness, the Copperhead Guard are both Venom's personal guards and the elite commando unit of the House of Serpents. They often take on the most vital and dangerous missions or lead critical field operations.

112637.name: The Globalist
112637.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As the leader of the jack-booted, international terrorist organization UNITY, the Globalist is dedicated to the destruction of all national governments and the unification of Earth into one harmonious order -- under his sole leadership. Possessed of a dark secret and ruled by a crippling megalomania, the Globalist is nevertheless a deadly player on the global stage

112638.name: Death Mask
112638.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While posing as a legitimate businessman, he channels his billions into P.H.A.N.T.O.M., a private terrorist force that uses subtle manipulation and corruption to weaken its enemies and increase its power.

112639.name: Battle Czar
112639.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the Soviet Bloc, the renegade super-soldier Battle Czar is often remembered as one of the few good things that came out of the Stalin era: A champion and hero of the people who performed mighty deeds in the cause of good.

Battle Czar is still a major force in Soviet culture, although he has grown disillusioned with the diluted and corrupt communism practiced today in the Soviet Bloc. He has resigned his post on the Soviet super-soldier team and sworn to lead a "pure" revolution of justice and reason to resurrect Lenin's dream in the modern age.

He's founded a private army, the Red Spider organization, with this goal. Possibly the most powerful being on the planet, Battle Czar is now a wild card. Both Washington and Moscow eye him warily...
